Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Homebodytwo
Reviews.Content: The Plaza Tour Eiffel is an excellent base for exploring Paris. This small, modern gem of a hotel is located in the Trocadero neighborhood, which relatives who live in Paris confirmed is indeed quite affluent. The area has several nearby brasseries/bistros, as well as a good selection of fine dining establishments.The metro is 5 minutes away, and the Eiffel Tower is about a 15 minute walk. Sightseeing buses also have stops about 5 minutes away, but we found tourist destinations such as the Hotel des Invalides and the Musee de Rodin are only about a 30 minute walk from the hotel! To top it off, the hotel staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home”
Reviews.Author: MarysaCzarna
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a residential area of Paris and yet it is within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and other attractions. The Metro is close by if you want to venture out further. There are wonderful restaurants and the entrance to the Metro across from the Eiffel Tower and several Museums and it is only about 5-10 minute walk. There is also a wonderful little turn around called the Place de Mexico where there is a Mexican restaurant and one of the best Italian restaurants both with a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower. The other thing we found at this turn around was a fantastic supermarket. On the days we just wanted to stay in for dinner and have a lazy evening we would just buy some bread, cheese and olives etc and bring to our room. The bakery next door had wonderful pastries and a Sushi Bar was across the street from the hotel. The room and bathroom were very modern and very clean. Breakfast every morning was a delight, and there was a fitness room. The stars of the Hotel were the staff. The staff made us feel like we were welcomed home every night when we would return from our daily adventures. When we discovered a big problem with one of our scheduled trips the manager of the hotel took it upon himself to help us out when our tour agent bailed out on us. Kiran Rangoo and his staff were not only pleasant but very courteous and helpful. They attended to all our needs promptly and always with a smile. We hated to leave them but we were off for more adventures in another part of town. We would stay there again when in Paris. We would also recommend the hotel to others. Do ask for a room overlooking the street and not the cafe, it will be less noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay at Plaza Tour Eiffel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ljn_uk
Reviews.Content: Location: As previous reviewers have mentioned it's a short walk to Trocadero metro (less than 5 mins), and not much further to the Eiffel Tower. The area around the hotel has some nice cafes and restaurants. The areas around the hotel appears to be reasonably upscale. Hotel: Arrived early afternoon & were warmly welcomed by a very professional young man on the front desk. The front desk staff were always very professional and polite and spoke excellent english. Room: Room was light & bright but compact (but we expected the room to be small) - our room faced the street but was very quiet at night. Double bed, good quality pillows & linens. Small wardrobe with hangers & shelves - good if you are staying for a few days. In room safe Full length mirror Chair & desk The windows fully open so you can let the fresh air in - this was a great feature. Flatscreen TV Free wifi (reception will give you the code) Bathroom was tiny but modern - style over substance, very difficult to store washbag etc Toiletries - good quality Breakfast: Our rate included breakfast (continental) and the food on offer was surprisingly good. Excellent coffee Super breads & pastries Cheese, meats, fruit, yogherts etc I would certainly return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “splendid from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: thomas01hahhah
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to hotel staff for contributing to a good break. Our visit was for a special occassion, made more special by the stay at the Plaza. arrived at 11.30 and pleasently surprised that our room was ready. Even better was being upgraded to the sixth floor with a room were from the balcony you could see the Eiffel Tower. welcomed by a pleasent young man on reception, did not catch his name and Daniel, cheery courteous and helpful. Room bright, comfortable, clean, bathroom modern, with a massive queen sized bed. Breakfast was a good starter for the day. Location excellent, 5 mins walk to Eiffel tower, restaurants close by. Did all the sights using the Batobus, hop on hop off on the seine. good value at 15 Euros per day, with no restrictions. The sunday market at the bastille well worth a visit, not your traditional english market full of tat. Fresh food, meat, veg , fish looked very appetising. Slightly disappointed at quality of restaurants, and beware, on a sunday, several closed, together with lot of shops. Travel tip, long queues in c de G airport for tickets. used ticket machine, 9 euros, left train at chatlet les halles and took a taxi, 10 euros. saved a lot of hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, perhaps better for pleasure than business”
Reviews.Author: Robsmodern
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel in a safe and upmarket area of Paris. It's a short walk to Trocadero metro, and not much further to the Eiffel Tower. The immediate area has some nice cafes and restaurants. And the area didn't feel very touristy, as this may be one of the few - if the only - hotel in the immediate area. The hotel itself was great too. Excellent and friendly service at the desk, and very comfortable rooms (though be prepared for small rooms - this is Paris after all). Super bed, fantastic shower, and little to no noise from the street or corridor. Plus, if your rate includes breakfast, you can have it delivered to your room. This is a nice touch that isn't always offered. The only downside is that wifi reception in the rooms isn't great, so if you have business to do then you'll most likely have to relocate to the (comfortable) lobby. Not a big problem though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KFisher66
Reviews.Content: We've just go back from a weekend break staying at the Plaza Tour Eiffel. We had a beautiful room on the sixth floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower from our balcony - fantastic! The beds are very comfortable, rooms nicely furnished and bathrooms well appointed. We had a deluxe room, so plenty of room for our suitcases etc. We only had one disappointment on our last morning - we had requested a late check out due to our flight - and luckily our room was available for an extra hour (until 13.00). We received a phone call at 11.57 on our last morning demanding that we checked out immediately (check out is usually at 12.00). My partner explained that we had had confirmation that we were able to depart an hour later, but the member of staff argued that this was not the case and was quite rude in his manner. We explained that we weren't packed or showered, but were given 15 minutes to check out. Thankfully we were provided with another room to quickly pack our things. Unfortunately we were very disappointed with the way this was dealt with - we completely understand that people make mistakes, especially in this case as the girl who gave us a late check out is new, however we were not given an apology by Reception staff, and one man was shooting us particularly nasty glares whilst we explained that we were simply not aware we had to be ready by 12.00 - letting us know that we had to leave immediately at 11.57 was a bit much! After we returned from packing in the other room, the Manager was on duty and did apologise nicely on behalf of the new member of staff - however we did not have an issue with the error - just the attitude of staff when dealing with it. Such a pity that this happened as we left Paris with a sour taste in our mouths (and slightly upset by the experience) - it really is a lovely hotel and the location is fantastic - lovely bistros nearby, a big supermarket, and of course, the Eiffel Tower so close!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for business stay, great location and good but discrete staff. Tiny room, bed and bath”
Reviews.Author: LadyCate
Reviews.Content: I stayed on my own for two nights for work. This was a smart hotel and much nicer than usual chain corporate hotels. Elegant and great decor. Staff very helpful. Lovely breakfast with excellent coffee and pastries. The room 102 was small and I hope the bed would not be classed as a double. Also small bath but immaculate White tiled bathroom. Perfect on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in a good area”
Reviews.Author: Richard R
Reviews.Content: The Plaza Tour Eiffel hotel is a well-maintained hotel in the Trocadero area of Paris a few minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. Rooms are a little small but perfectly fine for a short trip. Bathroom perfectly clean and a good shower. Bed really comfortable. Staff were helpful and had good English. Overall no complaints at all - recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: 21bailey
Reviews.Content: We recommend this hotel. We have found that, in Paris in particular, the facilities are often overstated and sometimes false. This is not the case with Tour Eiffel, it is a quality hotel ideally located. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are very clean and well appointed and the breakfast was good and fresh. One tip. If you want a taxi, walk to the end of the road to the taxi rank its cheaper. Would not hesitate to go again thebaileys

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel close to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first trip to Paris. This Hotel was lovely, not too big but very friendly and modern. Rooms were not massive but very clean and warm, nice to come back too after a cold winter walk. Staff were all friendly and helpful, food was nice, hot buffet with eggs and bacon, not just bread rolls and stuff. Tea and Coffee great. Beverages in the room would have been nice, what I would have expected from 4* but no other complaints. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, wonderful little place”
Reviews.Author: Fitzgig
Reviews.Content: ‎ We had a recent business trip to Paris and (as always) wanted to avoid the "corporate" hotels. We went on Trip Advisor and found this place. What a wonderful find. We highly recommend this hotel, will return to it the next time we are in Paris, and will be telling all of our friends about it. Yes, the rooms are small, but that is normal for Europe. If you are not a frequent visitor to Paris or other big European cities, then you might be surprized at the size of the rooms - but chalk that up to inexperience. In our first room, the lights around the mirror blew, so they moved us to the 6th floor (room 604). That room was more spacious (but still small by US standards), but it had a couch, a desk and two balconies. Unfortunately it was not until our last evening that we stepped out onto the balcony and VOILA! there was the Eiffel Tower. I was wondering why all the other reviews said you could see the tower from the 6th floor. If you end up on the 6th - step outside, even if you don't like heights. You will be glad you did! The place is absolutely spotless. They have really nice towels, big and thick. The towel warmer is really nice - I have decided that I am going to get one for my bathroom at home. I will agree with other reviewers that the bathtub/shower needs a curtain or someting. The classic European style with the tiny glass water deflector does not work. We flooded the bathroom every day no matter how we positioned the shower head. It is a little tricky stepping out over the very high tub wall ontto the bathroom floor after a shower - especially when it was sopping wet. I always felt guilty having to throw 2-3 towels on the floor to soak up the water. I tried! The water temperature is a little flukey - don't run the sink or flush the toliet when someone is in the shower. The breakfast was really great. We were there for 5 days and never once did we have any issue with running out of food or anything like that. Plenty of room to sit, lovely wait staff, great coffee and the croissants............ to die for. Nice fresh fruit as well as chopped fruit. We got a free breakfast coupon off of TripAdvisor, which was great. They have free WiFi. It slows down under load (like in the evening when many people are in the hotel using it), but it was reliable and FREE. The only suggestion I have there for improvement would be to not require that you re- login everytime. It might not have been such a nuisance - but they issue you two long abstract codes that you then have to enter in each time. This is a minor thing, but after losing the little paper they give you with the two codes on it - I finally typed it into a word document and then just cut and pasted when I had to. Minor nuisance only - not a big deal! Nice gym. The rooms were very quiet (and we slept in two different ones). The neighborhood is very toney, we never felt unsafe. Oddly, a lot of the wealthy back in the neighborhoods (not outside the hotel - I mean 2-3 blocks away) have dogs and they poop all over the sidewalks and no one picks it up. I was surprized - just watch where you walk once you get away from the hotel. Outside the hotel is as neat as a pin. The location was great. There was a great taxi stand down at the Trocadero (2 short blocks), as well as the Metro that will take you all over Paris very inexpensively. About 2 blocks the other way is the Plaza de Mexico. There is a big grocery store down that way called Casino. It is on the left, across the Plaza (thrid spoke/road to your right), it is sort of inside of a small indoor shopping mall. The grocery store is HUGE - sort of like a Super Target or SuperWalmart - food, rope, socks, books, etc. Great place to buy foodstuffs if you dont want to have to go to restaurants all the time. There is a TERRIFIC little restuarant down off of the Plaza de Mexico called Skabetti's. It is an Italian joint that has really good prices for the area. If you are looking for low key comfort food - go there. Great ambiance as well. Right across from the Casino market. Also, take the recommendations for where to eat from the hotel staff. I would not take their recommendation for lunch at the Le Coq thought. It was very expensive and not good value. It was crowded and we felt out of place there. We chanced into the Passy Cemetary which is 2 blocks from the hotel. That was fascinating. Reminded us of the Recoletta in Buenos Aires (only no cats). The closest I will ever get to Claude DeBussey! Finally, everyone at the hotel was so nice and so helpful. There was a woman on the weekend who was incredibly sweet. I do not know her name, but she was from Madagascar. The guys at the desk were very wonderful and helpful. A really great experience there. We will be back. This is really a great place to stay. Room Tip: All seemed good that I saw. 6th floor - rooms are bigger, more expensive I suspect (we got upgraded) and you will be able to see the Tower

The guys at the desk were very wonderful and helpful. A really great experience there. We will be back. This is really a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small, welcoming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob.PLondon
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not the largest i've stayed in but not bad, clean, modern and with all you needed for a short break. On our arrival the staff were extremely accommodating and kind. They spoke English but appreciated our attempts at French. The breakfast was nice and fresh but the hot food was not what were were used to. Didnt detract from the fact it was a nice start to the day. The bathroom was smart and modern and had a great shower. Flat screen TV with 2 English news channels, room safe, complimentary bottle of water (1 in three days). There is no bar or restaurant but the reception will pour you a drink for room service. There are some great cafe's nearby (Cafe Mexico just up the road was so friendly pro English and well priced) Situated 5 mins from the Trocadero Metro and in sight of the Eiffel Tower I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for work or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JumpRiver
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this upscale boutique-type hotel on three separate occasions, all for work. The location is excellent and there is a small bar in the lobby. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and they do offer breakfast. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfy. I've never had an issue with noise. They have wireless internet but as with many hotels, it can be very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict1283
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days over Christmas 2011. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small-ish but on par for Paris expectations certainly. The area felt very safe, and was a quick walk from the Trocadero metro station. For us, this was always going to be a hotel that we were not planning to be in very much- too much to do! Just within a block or 2 walk in almost any directions are shops, cafes, and restaurants (not to mention the Eiffel tower!). We chose the hotel as we wanted to be close to a great view of the tower, which the Trocadero area absolutely provides, we were astounded. It was easy to walk from the hotel up to the Champs Elysee and also over to the Trocadero, and the Eiffel Tower, so very central for what we were wanting. Wifi in the lobby- free business centre (ie computer and printer), very handy for printing passports etc. We did not have breakfast so can't comment on that. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris's gem.”
Reviews.Author: Merigee
Reviews.Content: A truly magical Christmas in Paris made possible by the Plaza Tour Eiffel Hotel. Mr Kiran Rangoo very kindly upgraded our room to the 6th floor, thereby, affording us a beautiful view of the majestic Eiffel Tower. The Hotel is perfect in every way, shape and form. The rooms, bathrooms, linen, breakfast are first class. The staff are truly unique amd a credit to this fine establishment. Thank you for everything and much, much more.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2europe
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 7 days in Aug 2010. Very nice and clean hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. They provide good quality soap, flip flops and bath robes. There is even a dryer in the bathroom to dry towels and keep them warm. The only complaint was the cleaning lady would slam the door of the room next to us and wake us up. I do recommend this hotel to others. And the staff are fluent in English.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay in France”
Reviews.Author: chrislema
Reviews.Content: The Plaza Tour Eiffel is a block from the Trocadero metro station in district 16. The first thing to note is that district 16 is upscale and safe, so walking to and from the metro at midnight is no issue (and you'll pass two embassies). The second thing to note is that you're close to two sets of great local restaurants - in Mexico circle and Trocadero circle. So there's no need to travel more than a block for great meals. The bakery next door is incredible as well. Make sure to stop by at 6:30 am as the bread is coming out of the ovens. The third is that the accommodations were fantastic. The room was great, bed was comfortable, staff were very helpful (and spoke great English). While we heard that six floor rooms see the Eiffel tower, room 100 (first floor) has a large bathroom, which was a big win! Our stay included breakfast each morning, which was a nice addition and a bit more upscale than your every day continental option. There is a nice gym as well, though we never touched it.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond friendly & helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: sonido4404
Reviews.Content: Every staff member we interacted with went above and beyond expectations. The staff was so thoughtful, when we asked for directions they practically walked us to our destination. I really can't say enough about the staff! Hotel rooms are on the smaller side, but modern and very clean. The breakfast buffet is diverse enough to meet most needs. The location was great! Close to public trans & tourist buses. A couple blocks to Eiffel Tower. And steps to amazing restaurants. When we go back to Paris we are staying at Plaza Tour Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, size and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SFR0629
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just went to Paris for 8 days. We stayed in the Deluxe room at PlazaTour Eiffel. Initially we thought it was entirely too small until we realized that the other room even smaller. We walked to most of the major sights using our maps on the iphone. The Eiffel tower was visible from our window. 3 of the nights we were so exhausted from walking all day so we ordered room service.The beef carpacio, cheese plate and the chocolate cake were great! For breakfast we went down to the breaksfast area on the bottom floor a few times then ordered in the room 2 days. I loved the pastry basket with jam. The eggs and bacon appeared to be undercooked so I didn't bother with them much. There is a small gym onsite that has just about everything you could need. The hotel staff appeared to be very friendly, assisted us with setting up a champagne tour and tour to Versailles. The staff also directed us to some very good restaurants for lunch when we did not stumble across one our selves. I loved the italian restaurant Di Vino which is a hop skip and a jump away. Ask for the Amarone wine. Overall I would say our stay was pretty great at this hotel. I'd definitely recommend it for a couple and maybe 1 small child if you don't pack as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: Jerry H
Reviews.Content: Great location! The rooms were a bit smaller than normal for $450 per night and the internet wasn't even on par with dial up. Also, I think it's the only hotel in Europe we stayed in that didn't have coffee or tea in the room. We were given 1 bottle of "complimentary" water our first night there. Seriously? Kinda cheap.The buffet breakfast was great and fresh. Other than that, the staff was absolutely fantastic. Professional, helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “What a view, what a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ShazzG
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous “boutique” type hotel in one of the best sections of Paris (16th arrondissment). A beautiful location. Extremely close to the metro and nearby are many restaurants and bistros without the noise and clutter. Everything truly was a walk away from everything, stores, bistros, groceries, etc, Trocadero Square. The hotel is just lovely and attentive. Not like your typical “chain” hotels. The staff I can’t even begin to tell you how wonderful and helpful they were. Kirian was fabulous as was George and every one of them. Believe me, we really used all their services for booking tours, breakfasts in rooms, questions, drinks, restaurants, you name it we asked and we always received great information and always happy and with a smile. The beds were VERY comfortable. My only ‘real’ negative was in the bathroom. We in the states are accustomed to a larger shower basin. The width of the shower was quite small and the shower head always went over the shower glass which only covered half of the length of the shower. The floor would always be wet. On the plus side, LOVED the heated towel rack! Taxi’s were gotten very promptly whether outside and walking or in the hotel. Word of caution though: Kirian was fabulous as was George and every one of them. When you have the front desk phone you a cab from the moment it is called into the cab and dispatched their meter is running. So if the taxi is halfway in another arrondissment it doesn’t matter, that meter is running till it reached the hotel. One Sunday evening we had the front desk call a cab and when we got into the cab to go the my daughter’s apartment (she is studying abroad in Paris) and it was usually 10 euros, we got into the cab and it was 11 euros upon entering the cab. Just be aware of that, it is what it is. The breakfast that the hotel offers is really quite enough. Yogurts, fruits, eggs, croissants, jam, baguettes, juice and coffee. The last week we were there it was brought up to our room. Just a great way to start the day. Ask for a room on the 6th floor. You’ll get a fabulous view of the Eiffel Tower (see pictures). Free Wi-Fi in your room and a computer downstairs in the lobby with a printer. If anything was needed to be printed out, all you had to do was go to the lobby. WE printed many tour tickets from downstairs. Notes: Bus and metro tickets are interchangeable. Metro is very easy to navigate. Bakery and fruit store are across the street if you find the breakfasts to expensive. If you are touring get the two day bus pass for the tour bus. It takes you to most of all the nearby “must see” sights (Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, Champs, etc. You can get off and on any time and they’ll give you headphones and you program in your language of choice. Take a day trip to Versailles. Just beautiful. If you have the time and are interested in history, go to Normandy. Moulin Rouge, the show was fabulous. You can save money by not having the dinner if you choose. They make you check your camera. BUT on a plus side, there is a photographer who goes table to table. Take a sunset or nighttime cruise down the River Seine. Just beautiful. In box me if you have any questions on any of the restaurants, sights, etc. Way too many to list.

Reviews.Title: “Four nights at Plaza Tour Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: J G
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at Plaza Tour Eiffel and four at another Paris hotel. PTE had far superior service. Their staff were friendly and were always looking for ways to be helpful, and my stay was very pleasant. I would suggest they add full shower curtains as the partial glass panel in our shower resulted in much water getting on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Paris trip with friends.”
Reviews.Author: felin508
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Paris with friends. From start to finish we had a lovely time . We booked two double rooms in the The hotel Plaza Tour Eiffel,the rooms were a little small however they were very clean with a nice shower and bath.The breakfast was good with a wide selection of food.The hotel was well placed with the Trocadero metro very close.The Eiffel tower ,Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees were all within walking distance. The most memorable thing about this hotel was the friendliness of the staff from the moment we arrived all of the staff could not have been more helpful , helping us to book the Eiffel tower ,sorting out taxis and overall being friendly and approachable.I would stay here again and recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the 16th arr”
Reviews.Author: 2ENTravelers
Reviews.Content: "Be a traveler, not a tourist. Nothing is bad, just different. Everything has its charm." We had a very good experience at this hotel in late October 2011. I would recommend it to anyone that can be a traveler. For tourists, find another cookie cutter chain hotel on the outskirts of the city with big sterile rooms and no personality. This hotel is a little city centric gem with lots of charm that is clean, comfortable and in a good location. Its 16th arrondisement location is excellent because the neighborhood is very quiet both day and night so you don't get any street noise when you are trying to rest. We learned that the 16th is an upscale and desirable part of Paris. We always felt safe when walking back from the Trocadero metro station late at night (about a 5-10 minute walk). We requested a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower in advance via email and were given a very nice room on the 6th floor. We could see the top half of the Eiffel Tower from our windows, which was quite a sight at night when it twinkled every hour on the hour. True our room was typically small, as are most city-center European hotels but the room was modernly furnished and the bed had a good mattress, down pillows and comforter providing a good nights rest. We had all we needed with the flat screen TV and updated, if cramped, bathroom since we didn't spend a lot of time there. The front desk and breakfast room staff were super courteous and friendly. We were always greeted with a Bon Jour or Bon Soir. One day I called the front desk to get the access codes for the free Wi-Fi expecting that someone would read them to me over the phone but instead the clerk printed and brought them up to our room in person. Very nice! It was convenient to have breakfast at the hotel - about 20 euro per person additional per day but worth it since it is a buffet. One cafe in Trocadero charged us 19 euro on our first day for ham, eggs, one croissant and an orange juice. The selection at the hotel buffet was very generous including eggs, ham, sausage, bacon, cheeses, fruit, yogurt, cereal, milk, juices, coffee and of course the heavenly croissants and pastries - as many as you can eat! Don't miss the nearby (two metro stops away) Marmottan Monet Museum if you like the impressionists - it has a little secret treasure trove of Monets and it is a small house turned into a museum so your feet won't be falling off when you finish! Overall, we loved this hotel and would stay here again. Remember - be a traveler, not a tourist!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: phuture
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this property. The staff were nice and friendly. The hotel is really close to the Trocadero metro station, 15 mins from the Eiffel tower and is located in a nice upscale residential neighborhood. This was a plus since we got a taste of a typical neighborhood: bakery, grocery store etc. and it was nice and quiet. It's also close to a bunch of restaurants with a nice view of the tower while you are people watching and having coffee. Rooms were standard European style and clean. No complaints there. The electronic safe in the room was useful. Here are some tips to maximize your visit: * To get to the hotel from the airport you can take the airport bus to Etoille, take the metro for a couple of stops to get to the Trocadero metro station and walk to the hotel. Alternatively, you could just take the metro from the airport which probably would take you longer * Get the 7 day visitee pass for the metro. This will save you a lot of time and money and is worth it since we used it a lot to get around everywhere. The pass works on the bus too and we used it on the night buses as well * Do pick up the free map they give you at the hotel. It has a better metro map than the other free maps that you can pick up from the airport * There's a nice bakery as soon as you exit the hotel and is quite convenient. They make really good croissants! * There are two bank ATMs if you just walk down the street. I don't think the banks there charge ATM fees but your US bank for sure will for foreign conversion fees and for the withdrawal. Btw, make sure you call your bank ahead of time and inform them about your travel abroad, especially if you have Ally otherwise they'll decline your cash withdrawal * You'll quickly figure out that the cost of buying water is the same as buying wine or beer. So make sure you bottle up some water before you leave the hotel. If you go to the gym at the lower level, they have a water fountain that you can use * The hotel provides free internet in the room and also in the lobby. There's a computer in the lobby that is connected to the internet and has a printer. This was super useful to print out your tickets online if you are going to Versailles (you'll literally save hours at Versailles if you buy your ticket online) or Moulin Rouge * If you buy items that are eligible for a VAT refund, make sure that you get on the right line at the airport for the refund depending on the carrier you are flying back on. We were in line for 20 mins just to find out that they won't stamp our refund since we were flying Air France and we needed to go upstairs to the other VAT refund office that handles Air France and other airline passengers! More importantly, have fun :) Paris is just great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: neskin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for one night on a week long trip to Paris. Fantastic location, only minutes away from Eiffel tower. Rooms were very tidy and well kept, felt at home as soon as we walked in. Staff were all very friendly and helpful, particularly with directions! :) would definitely recommend and will almost certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: craysnancy
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel located in an upscale residential neighborhood. It has a very small reception area and serves breakfast. It also has wine if you want a drink before heading out to dinner. It is located near the Trocadero where there are numerous restaurants and which has a great view of the Eiffel Tower. The staff was very friendly and helpful. One of the staff members told us about a little neighborhood restaurant, Le Scheffer, at 22 Rue Scheffer that serves fabulous French food. They have a menu in English although most speak little English. The room is a bit small by American standards but bigger than most others where we stayed in France. It was clean and had adequate space for our clothes and suitcases. It had free wifi. There is no hair conditioner in the bathroom, but I had my own. The bathtub is very narrow compared to those in the USA, but the same as those in all hotels in which we stayed in France. Our bed was quite firm. We are used to a soft Temprapedic mattress, so it seemed hard to us. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful area for a visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: LightFighter
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel located in a great neighborhood near the Trocadero.  My wife and I spent 6 nights there and absolutely loved it.  Our room was small but very clean and nicely decorated - breakfast was excellent with bacon, eggs, yogurt, cheese, meats, pastries and pancakes.  The neighborhood is superb - quiet and safe, 2 blocks to the Metro with bakeries, delis, laundry, pharmacies and lots of cafes all within a short stroll.  Best of all, the staff was wonderful and went out of their way to help with directions and talk about our day.  Highly recommended if you are looking for a cute boutique hotel in a fantastic residential area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: galloponthebeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our birthdays, Hotel staff were great, really helpful. Very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very good, shame they don't have evening meals!

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Kimplo
Reviews.Content: The room was a little bit small but very clean and comfortable. The hotel is located at an exclusive residential area, it was very quiet and we could sleep very well at night. Number of foods served for breakfast buffet is not so many but all of them were special and delicious. Wifi was free of charge with quite fast speed. All staffs were kind enough to enjoy our stay, they really concerned our status and conditions. Thx a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BShafiee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and then moved to another hotel. This one was definitely the better one, it was an actual hotel with professional staff, bell boy reasonable size elevator and good service. Free wifi was available in the room. The room was small but apparently that is not out of the ordinary in paris. (it was actually bigger than a room we had in new york!). The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. a lot of restaurants and cafes only 2-5 minutes from the hotel. They serve breakfast in the hotel for 20 euros but we found cafes in the area that had really good breakfast for 13 euros. but since the rest of the menu was priced reasonably I guess their breakfast must have been worth the price. Very close to Eifel tower. From metro station Trocadero it is about 5 minutes walk to the hotel. The room has air conditioning, hair dryer, towels, safe, no minibar though. They didnt have conditioner in the bathroom the first day but brought one up when we asked, on the third day though they said they don't have any conditioner so I dont know if it will be available in the future upon request either. the bathroom had a half wall to prevent water from going everywhere but it didnt help that much, aparently though that is the style in paris as the other hotel we went to was exactly the same! We will go here again if we ever go to paris again and we definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: slashgari
Reviews.Content: All the staff at this hotel are courteous and helpful. Rooms are small for 3 but comfortable. I liked the location, long walk to Champ Elysees, but close to metro station. close to Eiffel tower. I was more impressed by the friendliness of the staff which usually you don't see much in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We loved being there, just like a second honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Andrea A
Reviews.Content: The trip was an unexpected gift. The hotel was perfectly located, just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower, subway station about 150 mts., The Triumphe Arch about 25 min walk. Many restaurants in the area. Very quiet zone yet very near from the Seine. All the staff is very kind and helpful. Hope we can get back soon

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGrlNY
Reviews.Content: Husband and I just spent 4 nights at the Plaza Tour Eiffel, and were very very pleased with our stay. First, the location is perfect - in the upscale 16th arrondissement, very safe with a neighborhood feel, and just steps away from the Trocadero Metro station. The downside was that we felt far away from the tourist areas, which would normally be a good thing, but since we visited during the month of August, many of the local businesses nearby were closed. Tip, which we wish we had discovered earlier: if you're there during August, head down to Rue des Belles Feuilles (2 blocks away) to visit the boulangeries and other small shops there. There is also a large Casino supermarket you can shop at. The staff was outstanding - always friendly, and super helpful. Again, we had planned out all of our meals only to discover the majority of the restaurants in Paris were closed in August. So we compiled a new list and the staff graciously called literally over 20 of the restaurants we listed to check if they were open. In the end, they ended up making reservations for us at a couple nearby. I speak French, but the staff spoke very good English. The hotel is a boutique hotel - our room was small, but had a lovely view of the Eiffel Tower. It was very clean and modern, bedding was clean and was changed daily. The bathroom was quite spacious and updated. There is free wi-fi which is a bit slow, but was fine for the internet research we needed to do. Tip: 2 of our favorite restaurants on this trip were within walking distance of the hotel, in the 7th arrondissement (a scenic 20 min walk). Les Cocottes (no reservations), and La Fontaine de Mars (the front desk can make reservations for you and you will be treated like royalty). Both were reasonably priced and offered GREAT food. We went to each restaurant twice, as our options were limited. Would absolutely recommend this hotel, loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: phmw84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a family trip to Paris (2 Adults and an infant). We were impressed by the cleanliness, the decor and the spaciousness of the room. The bed was comfortable and the rooms were quiet. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, eager to help with bags etc. The elevator was large enough and modern, in fitting with the rest of the hotel. The internet was extremely fast and reliable and there was a free printer in the reception area. The location was good, being a leisurely 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and 5 minutes to the Metro. On the downside, the housekeeping threw away some things that were not rubbish, and it would have been nice to have kettle facility for warming the baby bottles, but to be fair we were given free use of the kitchen at anytime for this. Overall we were very happy with our stay here, and would recommend to anyone, particularly those with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Florence07
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at this lovely hotel. A very nice room, small but ok, lovely decor, super clean and modern yet very Parisian chic. The staff very efficient, polite and friendly. To top it off the location is fabulous. We will most certainly be back, well done on such a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: marianneblanch
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here and loved both the area and the hotel itself. it is close to the Eiffel Towere without the crowds. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The room was clean, comfortable and beautiful. We had breakfast included and really appreciated the opportunity to eat downstairs before leaving for a full day of sightseeing. The food was good and the staff was very friendly. The hotel is really just beautiful. The only downside, although minor for us, is that the wifi is very slow. Folks needing internet access to work while in Paris will need someplace else to plug into. But overall, we fell in love with this hotel and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Simply devine.”
Reviews.Author: Merigee
Reviews.Content: This hotel's staff, especially Mr Kiran Rangoo, made our visit Paris a truly exceptional city break. Attentive, courteous, helpful are just a few of a reprtoire of compliments we could mention. Otherwise, the location of the hotel is perfectly placed close to the Majestic Eiffel Tower. Breakfast was delightful and the rooms were equipped to a high standard. Overall a very impressive hotel and staff which we highly recommend. Once again, a BIG thank you to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, Brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: melaniejbuscombe
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location close to metros, post office, food, and Eiffel tower is only a 10 minute walk! Staff were amazing and highly attentiveand efficient to all our needs, extremely helpful, very good with english and extremely polite. The whole hotel had an overall impressive cleanliness and postive vibe. The room like all European hotel rooms was small but practical and well maintained and equiped. Would defiantely recommend and would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, just great value”
Reviews.Author: Sadbird2
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights. The location is brilliant, a few minutes walk from the Trocadero metro station and the Eiffel Tower. We noticed a few embassies based in the surrounding streets so the area is quite quiet and reserved, no rowdiness in evidence whilst we were there. The room was small, but very elegant, and had a nice boutique feel to it. It was very clean, the bathroom was modern and the complementary toiletries were lovely. The buffet breakfast was excellent, a great choice of fruit, yoghurts, bread, cheeses, meats and pastries. Every morning there was a different hot selection too. We made the most of this meal, and took rolls and fruit with us on our travels around Paris for alfresco lunches. The staff were unobtrusive and helpful, the hotel provides a very useful guide to nearby restaurants, museums and sights. We visited a very busy Italian restaurant just around the corner called Il Conte, which was full of locals (a good sign!) very reasonably priced and the food was delicious! To sum our experience up, it was the perfect place to stay and made a great base for our sight seeing weekend. I would recommend this to anyone who appreciates a little luxury after a hard day visiting the various sights Paris has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: bela069
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that would accommodate a couple and 2 kids, that have enough space but still have good prices. We founded it. What I loved most it was all the details I've found when I got there, The beautiful water, the macarons, the chocolates, the welcoming letter, the packages of the bathroom and so on. Small details that make so much difference! The breakfast was very good also. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Such a gem!”
Reviews.Author: RMS83
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel! The staff were so friendly (also speak perfectly good English) and are ever willing to give suggestions on places to see and restaurants to eat. Hotel is also located just 3 mins walk from the Trocardero station (on line 9 and 6). We got a little lost on the first day trying to find the hotel from the metro station but eventually found our way. basically, from the station, take exit 4 (Ave. Gorges Mendel) and once out of the station, turn right and walk till you reach the first line (Rue De Greuze). Once on the lane, walk down to No. 32 (takes abt a minute or so). Hotel was in a great central location and we walked everywhere! Arc de Tromphe was abt a 20 min walk from the hotel (you can also take the metro but walking was just so much more fun!) and it will lead you to Champs de Elysee. Aboout another 30 mins walk will lead you right to Place de la Concorde (with the beautiful obelisk) and if you continue you walk, you will go by the jardin des Tuileries right to the Louvre Museam. A long walk indeed but very do-able if the weather is perfect and you have good walking shoes. Don't bother with the breakfast at the hotel. There is a charming bakery just next door which have the most amazing freshly baked goodies. We had great baguette sandwiches and yummy pistachio tarts. It's closed on Saturdays though. Everytime we walked back to our hotel, we could not help but see the stunning Effiel Tower views from the Trocardero. Even more spectaular at nights! Do sit by the steps, with a nutella crepe (from one of the stalls at the area) and watch the blinking lights that come on every hour at the Eiffel Tower at night. The feeling is just magical. From Trocardero, you can walk down right to the Eiffel Tower and the River Seine (takes about 10 mins). We took the River Seine cruise (so romantic!) and cost us about 12 euros for the hour long cruise. The hop-on hop-off batobus tour also operates from there. Overall, an excellent hotel - rooms are a good size, clean and comfortable with free wi-fi access. Another thing, do visit the Chateau De Versailles if you have a day to spare. It's really worthwhile. Don't bother with expensive tours as you can get a free personal tour in the palace itself. Also, it is very easy to get there from the hotel. Take line 9 to the end (Pont de Sèvres) and then get out at the bus exit and take number 171 to the end. A great hotel indeed! Will surely recommend=)

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: robkielty
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several hotels in Paris and thios is the best by far. I would describe this as a small boutique hotel. Situated by the Trocadero and within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Arc De Triomphe and the Trocadero Metro: its a pleasant area just far enough from the main tourist areas to be comfortable. There's a good selection of local bars and restaurants and getting to major tourist sights is easy. The staff are very friendly and bend over backwards to help. the rooms although small are beautifully fitted out and comfortable. I would recommend this to any travellers to paris.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, overpriced....”
Reviews.Author: Bizzy_TravellerUk
Reviews.Content: You can't come to Paris and expect anything less than small rooms and ridiculously overpriced food. However this hotel really exemplifies the art of charging huge amounts of money for what equates to a tarted up bed and breakfast. YES - the room was nice (minute, but clean and modern), but WOW - Eur275 ? In La Defense I can standardly get a room for Eur200 that would be twice the size with ten times the amenities. Eur18 for a very standard, slightly stale chicken sandwich is taking liberties - especially when you have to wait AN HOUR for it to arrive. The staff are very friendly though and keen to help. They carry the weight of the overpricing and poor facilities. Breakfast is called out by some on here as 'delightful' and 'good selection'. Where have you been eating ? Motorway service stations ? The breakfast was scant, claustrophobic and simply uninspired. Given there is an artisan boulangerie next door, I would have thought they could have done better. I shan't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: kiwis1234
Reviews.Content: I feel completely ripped off. This hotel is way overpriced for what it is. There is no hot water for showers. Rooms are very small no where to even put your luggage. Shower leaks puddle on bathroom floor. One English tv channel that flicks every second due to poor reception and it's definately not a large tv like advertised. Internet very slow and also drops out. This hotel just has a very good photography in regards to the photos on their website. Good location, breakfast and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Elegant small hotel is not what you expect....”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Business_Guy
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I will say I liked it. I really liked it. I was not wowed when I arrived, in fact I thought it was very plain and ordinary because thats not what I expected or was prepared to see......such a simplistic form of contemporary hotel in the heart of the16th in Paris. There are no photos of the outside of the hotel around because well its boring.....there is no historic facade or glorious entrance. Its just form and function and funny enough, thats what I really liked about it in the end - its simple-ness. You come to realize, simple is good in a city overrun with camera wielding tourists (of which I was one!). Generally the service is great if you attempt as much as possible in French...they really try hard to please and are very helpful. The front desk staff are especially helpful although one must realize this is a small hotel and they can't provide the services like the large chains. The rooms are surprisingly large....for Paris, with dreamy beds and really nice features. There is no mini bar or fridge (you can get ice in a bucket at most times) and you can't have a kettle in your room but and beside all those facts the rooms are great. Breakfast was a very good spread and very consistently well done. Whats really great about the hotel is the location....close to the Eiffel tower, the river, the Bois de Boulogne park (although don't go there at night as its well known red light district), shopping, great side street restaurants. The place has it all. Highlight: Walking 100m down the street to the Place de Mexico to see the Eiffel tower at dusk...one of the best street scape views in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for business in the 16th”
Reviews.Author: pamarx200
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly unusual for Paris. First: the room is decent sized, perhaps one and half or twice as large as the typical Parisian hotel. It could be in Asia or north America. Second, everything in the room is contemporary and very functional from a users point of view. The internet connection works, the safe is laptop-sized, the TV is a flat-screen; the bathroom is totally renovated. One doesn’t get the feel that nothing has been changed since the hotel opened three decades ago, despite its “traditional look” from the street. Third, the hotel actually makes an effort to serve. I asked for a hot water kettle in the room, and they actually put one in. There is free printing in the lobby. The stationery is of a good quality. The only complaint is that housekeeping doesn’t replace used toiletries every day. These are high quality – Fragonard—and perhaps they are scrimping. But they only give guests one set during the whole stay, which is fine if you are staying for one night, but not good if you stay for three or four nights. Lastly, the hotel is very well located. A few minutes from Trocadero metro station and jogging along the Seine or Champs de Mars (Eiffel tower); a few minutes walk from great shopping and conveniences on rue de Passy or Victor Hugo; and a few minutes walk from many business addresses in the 16th arrondissement. Overall, the hotel represents good value amidst an overpriced Parisian hotel market.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, but overpriced and soulless.”
Reviews.Author: Cymro29
Reviews.Content: Comfortable beds, quiet street. Small room and tiny bathroom, and this was the second highest grade. Not sure how this hotel can be 4 star with no restaurant and no mini-bar in the room. Staff friendly enough but a bit slow on the uptake. No security when we got home at midnight, which was a surprise. Decent breakfast. Good wireless internet. Expensive, like all Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was Perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas50_61
Reviews.Content: The Plaza Tour Eiffel is a small friendly hotel and just a 5 minute walk to the Trocadero, in a lovely peaceful location. The room we stayed in was very comfortable and clean. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast was continental buffet style with plenty of choice. In all our travels this was by far the quietest city hotel we have stayed in and was perfect for our short break to Paris. There are many restaurants within walking distance and away from the normal tourist locations and on our arrival were given some very helpful information on these. We would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, clean rooms, PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: OrvosVagyok
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I brought my wife to Paris to propose and we stayed at this hotel for the week. It was an amazing and memorable week in Paris and this hotel only made the whole experience better. First the location is ideal. It's only two blocks from the Trocadero area with the Eiffel tower just across the bridge and the metro is less than two block's away. However, the hotel is far enough off the main street for peace and quiet in a safe neighborhood. Around the corner, you will find a small bakery, a deli, two small grocery stores and a pharmacy. We stopped at these stores a few times to pick up wine, baguettes and fromage to have ourselves Parisian style picnics. You will also find many cafes and restaurants within walking distance. As for the hotel, it is modern and tastefully decorated. The room was spotless, modern and comfortable. The bathroom was clean and modern as well. The room and bathroom were slightly on the small side but this is expected in Europe. The bed was comfortable, there was plenty of closet space and there was a flat screen TV with several channels, a couple in English but lets face it, you don't go to Paris to sit in the room and watch TV. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, always eager to help and answer questions. The room was cleaned meticulously everyday and whenever we needed something such as an extra towel or a bucket of ice, it was never a problem. There's no mini bar so the bucket of ice comes in handy. And to top things off, they had free WIFI. 5 stars across the board for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a Paris hotel I would happily return to”
Reviews.Author: magpie1998
Reviews.Content: It's particularly difficult to find a hotel in a strange city if you don't want to stay at another chain hotel. Clean rooms, helpful staff, and a great, quiet location all contribute to to what is a really nice experience. Three blocks from the Trocadero and no more than twenty minutes by foor to the Eiffel Tower, Plaza Tour Eiffel is well located for visitors who want to walk in Paris. Good shopping is also within easy walking distance. On the downside, the breakfast buffet is good (better than that in many hotels I've stayed in), but it is still hard to imagine paying for it in addition to the daily room rate. With the choice of bakeries and restaurants nearby, this really isn't a major concern at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at a superb location!”
Reviews.Author: tabs_eff
Reviews.Content: I booked this online after reading a number of reviews that recommended it. I wanted a genuine 4* Hotel (rather than a 3* Hotel ticking some 4* boxes) in a superb location and it did not disappoint. We received excellent service on checking in early; finding the concierge welcoming and polite helping recommend with the day’s programme and mapping. The room was fairly small but certainly not uncomfortable with a spacious bathroom. Location- COULD NOT BE ANY BETTER. With a pleasant cafe just outside the front door and the Trocadéro (overlooking the Eiffel Tower and its Metro Station) within 300m. Amenities- All that what you would expect from a quality 4* hotel. Excellent attention to detail with good fixtures and fittings, toiletries, delightful linen, Wi-Fi, great buffet breakfast, gym etc. However, the list price on the door stated 320 Euros. I don't think that I would pay that much for it but certainly would pay my £190 again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAS2008
Reviews.Content: We checked out this hotel on Trip Advisor and the reviews were very accurate. It was located literally round the corner from the Eiffel Tower in a quiet street. There was a reasonably priced supermarket nearby which sold everything. The hotel was clean and tidy and the rooms although not huge were perfectly adequate. The breakfast consisted a range of cereals, scrambled eggs and bacon, cheeses, pastries, fresh (with pith) fruit juices, dried and fresh fruit. There was also a gym if you're into that sort of thing. The hotel was central to everything and there were plenty of restaurants, bars and cafes nearby. We particularly liked Cafe Kleber down Rue de Kleber which did really good food but it wasn't cheap - the same as anywhere in Paris - and the drinks (again as in Paris in generally) were extortionate. The hotel was at the Victor Hugo metro stop - 12 stops from La Chappelle (Gard du Nord - Eurostar). The metro was really easy to negotiate. We managed to do the top of the Eiffel Tower at night which was an amazing experience. However to avoid the queues book your ticket on the internet well in advance, ie several days or even weeks beforehand. We didn't and couldn't get any - we even tried to do it at the hotel but without success. We went about 8.30pm on the off chance of getting in and although we queued for about 30 - 45 mins (short in comparison to the day time queues) it didn't seem that long and although the summit was closed when we joined the queue it was open by the time we bought our tickets. The tower is lit up at night and twinkles like a Christmas tree for 5 mins on the hour - absolutely incredible to see. The Sacre Coeur is quite a walk from the hotel but then it's not central to anything and I would suggest staying around the Eiffel Tower to ensure you're reasonably close to the main sites. We walked everywhere but you can of course get the metro, open top bus and river boat. There are loads of lovely parks if you want/need some peace and quiet. It was a fabulous city break and we'd recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: globalmanu
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just 5 minutes walking from the Eiffel tour. Very nice and quiet area. Rooms are small, but clean and modern. Very friendly staff, always keen to help. Breakfast is not massive but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent reception staff”
Reviews.Author: AngelaCEngland
Reviews.Content: Apart from the room being on the small side, I would recommend this hotel, it was spotlessly clean, in a nice area, very central, excellent breakfast and the reception staff could not have been more helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Very Welcoming and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: lalooman
Reviews.Content: Great location, after the thrill of the Eiffel Tower it is so close to metro you can zip anywhere. The room was kind of small but cozy and adequate. The staff felt like old friends, always willing to take time to assist. Breakfast was filling for a busy day of sight seeing and the staff in the dining room was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “staff is great but rooms are poor and substandard”
Reviews.Author: piku247
Reviews.Content: located about 10 minute walk from Eiffel tower reception staff is great- Cyril and George were great Rooms are small -the rooms we stayed in was on the 6th floor , you may bump into things and hit your head , i fell after tripping coming out of the bath room- dangerous. bed was very uncomfortable- not a double bed , but 2 singles pull together, and in the second room the 3rd bed was a pull out sofa in very poor condition, nobody can really sleep in saving grace for this hotel is its location , staff and breakfast which was decent not good for the family to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Paris vacation”
Reviews.Author: bobeve
Reviews.Content: So many choices for hotel stay in Paris, we were very happy to be at Plaza Tour Eiffel Hotel. The entire staff was extremely professional, welcoming, courteous and informative. The hotel was spotless (tub a littel small), Excellent buffet breakfast, tasty, fresh with many choices. The upscale neighborhood was clean, quiet and safe with easy access to Metro ( two short blocks). All amentities available down the block e.g.restaurants, fruit store, bakery etc. Leaving the Trocodero station the Eifffel tower view was a beautiful way to begin and end our day. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely time”
Reviews.Author: Adele48
Reviews.Content: WE have just returned from a 3 night stay in Paris and we would recommend this hotel. As other reviewers have siad it is very clean, modern and accomodating and is set in a lovely residential district about 5 minute walk from the Eiffel tour. We spent very little time in the hotel as there was too much to see and do in Paris but we had a great night's sleep every night. The bathroom is small as are the rooms and there was an issue with the water from the shower pouring onto the floor as the shower screens are not wide enough. Breakfast was lovely - typical French fayre with a few hot options (egg, bacon, sausage of sorts) but all very fresh and replenished regularly. The staff were without exception very pleasant and helpful and we were made feel very welcome. Getting around Paris is easy on the Metro and we walked for miles and miles and miles! One word of warning though is to watch your bags and wallets - we saw a couple of people succumb to the pick pockets on the Metro and we were also scammed by a man at the ticket machine at Gard de Nord when we were trying to get out to Stade de France to watch the rugby. He appeared like he was a guard and offered to buy the tickets and we give him cash - given that there were thousands of people behind us and we didn't have a lot of time to think we agreed and ended up with two metro tickets which were worth about £3.40 yet we had seen on the screen the tickets would cost twenty Euro and that is what we gave him! We were annoyed with oursleves but it all happened so quickly! Anyway - just a word of warning. There is a great little shopping area if you go out of the hotel turn left and walk up to the roundabout and then take any of the streets on the left, one is full of clothing shops and the other full of food outlets / patisseries and a small supermarket. We loved St Germaine and the Marais district and had great Falafel in the Marais area. We went to Notre Dame and managed to time it perfectly for a mass which was lovely. We made full use of Citywalkingtours and Tamara and Chris showed us around the city which we might not have found otherwise. Overall we had a fabulous time - we crammed as much in as we could and didn't cover 1/10th of things to see and do. Will definately go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Stay”
Reviews.Author: karuna94
Reviews.Content: My office sent me to Paris for a meeting and they booked room at Plaza Tour Eiffel, Paris. I was staying there for 7 days and i want say that i was very happy with ther service of their staffs. The hotel are very clean and quite. It very near ti Eiffel Tour and Metro as well. I also want to introduce Mr Geogre who very very helpful and knowledge. He can give us very good guide especially for those are new at Paris. Ones again i want say thanks to the hotel management and Mr Geogre for his kindness and honest. If anyone want stay there please ask for him for any assistance. Karuna, MALAYSIA

Reviews.Title: “everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: mark861660
Reviews.Content: very clean and contempary. staff were extremely friendly and helpful. this hotel is very close to the eiffel tower etc anywhere else just get a ticket for tour bus, which you can hop on and off at any time and it can be used for 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem of a hotel, great decor, great staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jl424nyc
Reviews.Content: From the wonderful welcome at checkin thoughout til checkout, this hotel proved the perfect place to stay for our 1 night in Paris. Delphine (the manager) and the entire staff were amazingly graciuos and made my wife and I feel like King and Queen for a day. The service is impeccable, the hotel decor is elegant and sophisticated, yet very warm and confortable; a perfect combination and the location, tucked away on a quiet residential street just a block from the Trocadero is perfect for touring the city. We cannot wait to visit again, this time for a much longer stay. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Choose This Hotel and Be Very Happy Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Marksway
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself looked at Trip Advisor prior to going Paris and came across the Plaza Tour Eiffel and after looking at a few others we decided to choose this hotel as it was the best looking and in the best location. Upon arrival at the hotel as soon as we walked through the doors we was greeted by kind very well presented staff, they looked very smart and their service they provided was very smart also. We did not see one little piece of dirt in this hotel and was very impressed with our entire stay, we do recommend this hotel for the brilliant staff nice breakfast layout, and all attractions easy to get to. The hotel is in the perfect location, we visited so many places via Metro (Must say very easy to use), the nearest attraction was the Eiffel Tower, which was about 5 minutes walk, you can see it on very clearly at the end of the hotels road. Me and my partner went their loving each other very much and came back loving each other even more so, for those that say the French are rude you are mistaken because the hotel staff and restaurant staff were very kind and helpful. We will be going back again to the same hotel as we liked our stay very much.. Thankyou very much to all the staff at Plaza Tour Eiffel Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL, STAFF REALLY HELPFUL, STOPLESSLY CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: sammy186408
Reviews.Content: our fisrt time in Paris, the hotel give us directions on how to get to the hotel from the airport, the journey was relly easy on the train. The room was spotless, the Eiffel tower was at the bottom of the street. Well recommended. The staff were very friendly on helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: philnash
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many hotels in Paris over 30 years, I found this one of the best. The attitude of the staff - particularly the Reception team was certainly the best I have experienced. The hotel accommodation was good value for money and the breakfast was fine. I would recommend this hotel but, of course, it depends on which location people want - this fitted perfectly on this occasion.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, very courteous and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: johnskidsng
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, proffesional service. Clean rooms, sufficient gym and good location. 5 mins walk to the metro. Very quient ambience, the staff makes you feel as if you are the only one staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I've Never Been Treated Better”
Reviews.Author: b_defender1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply fantastic. The manager (I'm sorry, I should have remembered your name) and staff (especially Daniel) went so far beyond their duty. First, let me preface this with telling you that I proposed to my girlfriend while we were there. I told the staff my plans, and they upgraded us to the best room in the hotel. We had a balcony and a view of the Eiffel Tower that we could see from our bed. The room, while somewhat small, were simply fantastic; the bed was comfortable; the breakfast was adequate, the location was just about perfect, but it's the service that stands out above all others. As I said, I asked my girlfriend to marry me. I told them of this on Saturday, and they arranged for flowers to be sent (not only sent, but they staged the room with flowers on the bed and flower pedals all over the room), the champagne to be chilled, a delicate presentation of the glasses with pedals, and a box of chocolates. Simply AMAZING! My fiancee (by the time we entered the room), took one step in the door and started crying. It was a combination of effort from Daniel who ordered the flowers (and came WAY under budget while still ordering the extra pedals; which I didn't specify but am oh so glad that he did) and the manager (please forgive me for not remembering your name!) who staged the room to be so breathtaking that it brought tears to her eyes and caused her to drape around me and just finalize the most perfect evening. We are forever grateful for your hospitality and for being a part of our special day, and will come back and stay there without even considering another location. Our travels to Paris will be frequent, and your hotel will be our choice from this point forward. For those considering staying in this hotel, when you enter, you're treated with the highest level of respect. The sleep was good, the location perfect, and the staff was, well, you've read my post. Please, don't hesitate on choosing this hotel; you won't regret it! Oh, and if you're searching for a fantastic dining experience, look up Paul Chene. I'll write a review of his restaurant soon, but you will be glad you looked it up. Our trip was simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: “a basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: baroma
Reviews.Content: it's faaar from a four star hotel as advertised. the location is ok and the front desk staff are very helpful and polite, but.....the hotel badly needs renovating, especially the entrance lobby. the rooms are basic. the heating is absolutely nerve- racking, the only possibility being A/C , which is extremely loud and wakes you up during the night. the breakfast is basic. a modest hotel, but it's clean and it's Paris, isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: extased
Reviews.Content: Very good location, walking distance to all sights but in a quiet residential street. Please be advised the staff at this hotel are ALL such lovely people! They are friendly, inviting, professional, courteous, charming and above all very knowledgable. The hotel itself has been decorated to a high standard with some nice touches. The room was modern and well equipped, fittings and finish were good and the bed was spotlessly clean and comfy for a hotel bed. The hotel staff went out of their way for us, keeping our bags downstairs for us while we explored the city once more after checking out on our last day. Breakfast buffet was hearty and fresh, served in an intimate basement dining room adjacent to the gym that didn't feel claustrophobic at all. Food was of a high quality and enough to last until lunch time even when walking for 6 hours. This hotel is head and shoulders above many other more expensive hotels in Paris and I wouldn't hesitate to come back in a few years time. I've already recommended it and will keep doing so.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer01
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to Paris, we could not have picked a better hotel. The location was ideal - close to Trocadero and the Eiffel Tower and within easy reach of all the mian attractions. Service was excellent - the staff were friendly and went out of their way to be of help. The 'eat as much as you like' buffet breakfast was superb with a large continental selection and also scrambled eggs and bacon! The room was comfortable and clean and just the right temperature. Everything was modern and well presented. A totally good expereince and I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel with wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: sailgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Plaza Tour Eiffel twice on business recently, both times for 3 night stays. This small boutique hotel is on a quiet street in a lovely residential area of the 16th on a quiet street, yet only 5 minutes walk to Trocadero, and within 15 minutes walk of Eiffel Tower, Arch de Triomphe and Champs Elysee. Many lovely shops, cafes and restaurants are found in the immediate area, and both Metro and bus lines are easily accessed. We reached the hotel from Gare du Nord on the metro in 20 minutes, with one connection. The staff was universally warm, friendly and efficient. They evinced a genuine concern that we enjoy our stay. Restaurant recommendations they made were spot-on. The rooms were of reasonable size and surgically clean. Lovely modern bathrooms, and the beds were exceedingly comfortable. On both occasions, we were given rooms on a high floor with small balcony that overlooked the Eiffel Tower. The free wifi connection was good. Breakfast room is small but never felt crowded. The breakfast buffet was standard French breakfast, of a good quality. Excellent coffee! Nice selection of champagnes by the glass and single malts at the tiny bar in reception area. I will happily stay at the Plaza Tour Eiffel again, and have already recommended it to several friends.

Reviews.Title: “shame about the cold morning showers(no hot water)”
Reviews.Author: julieayanna
Reviews.Content: great location 5 mins to Trocadero, friendly staff,charming gentleman on reception during the day,clean rooms just no luxury , basic clean decor , a very good quality 3star not a 4star very very noisy elevator(lift ) could not sleep from the noise, all night and i spoke to other guest in lobby every one had same problem,noise and hot water trouble,but all in all not a bad stay, just wish i had the chane to get a good sleep night before my friends Wedding , i was Knackered!!for people who go to Paris to party hard and not sleep then no problem.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable but over priced and slightly back street location”
Reviews.Author: Ajmeaden
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris a few times over the years and trying different hotels I opted to stay at Plaza Tour Eiffel as the website showed a 4* hotel and looked good. On arrival, the Metro stop is indeed a 4 minute walk, but you have to walk up a back street thats off the main hub, its cobbled as well. The Hotel looks good as you approach and on entering the place you are greeted with oppulence and friendly staff. I have no complaint about the staff or the reception, and the porter service of taking our bags up while we checked in, fantastic service. Our room on the 4th floor when we opened the door was small, very small for a superior room, superior in france means standard in the uk and elsewhere in the world. The room was well laid out asnd a very comfortable bed, the bathroom was very clean and complimentary shower and bath products. The view however was of the flats opposite and what ever they were doing. we could also just make out the top of the Eiffel Tower if we leaned out of the window. The shower was one of the worst contraptions I have ever used. To use the shower you had to hold the shower on you rather than leaving it attached tom the wall as if you did it would only spray onto the wall, once I had mastered this it was very good, But I have not had to use a shower like that in years either at home or in a Hotel. I cannot comment on Breakfast as we did not eat in the Hotel, we ventured out to a local brasserie, which I can whole heartedly reccommend, it was right next to the Metro entrance at the trocedero,I forgot the name though, sorry. In all the hotel is very pleasant, well situated to the trocedero but it is not worthy of 4* and is no where near woth the money that it charges, I have stayed in cheaper hotels around the world and had a much better level of room. I would not recommend this place unless you dont mind spending alot of money for very little.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with one exception at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Bambi0920
Reviews.Content: This hotel itself was just fine - clean enough, small rooms (but not unexpected), breakfast is available on site if you'd like, and it's walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. Unfortunately, we had a couple of frustrating experiences (mostly with the same member of the front desk staff). At various times during the trip, we were woken up by vacuuming earlier in the morning, called in our room at midnight about a question we had two hours earlier, and on the final day, after dicussing a possible time change for the airport shuttle, they managed to cancel it altogether. Also, at one point, we asked how to get to Versailles and were given incomplete information. Thanks for telling me I need to get the train but you could have mentioned we need to change trains twice from here... you know? We couldn't have been the first people to ask!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: anca2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four nights in august 2010. The location is great so is the staff, but it does not worth four stars. The room is very small and the breakfast is a waste of money. The tour eiffel is very close by ,10 minutes walk and the metro station Trocadero is 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “magic”
Reviews.Author: joy035
Reviews.Content: this is a lovely hotel in a quiet area 5 mins walk from the eiffel tower the staff are very friendly helpful and ready and willing to assist in anyway they can our request for hot water so that we could make a cup of tea in our room was always meet with "oh you english and your cups of tea" we spent one evening in the bar just chatting with the staff and we both learnt alot about each others cultures There are several bars and resturants near by and a supermarket very close its with easy walking distance for the hop-on-hop of bus and i would definately stay there again if i was lucky enough to get to paris again the only down side is not kettle in your room so you either have to buy coffee from the bar (4.50 euros per cup or go out to get a drink)

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Breezybre
