Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best part of our trip. The staff spoke perfect english and were always helpful. They gave us maps and directions wherever we wanted to go. They helped me to understand the tube system, which was necessary to visit everywhere in paris. The room was small but had all the amenities I required. I loved this hotel, it made my trip to Paris!! Thanks again to the wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: traveller_spain
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel travelling by car to Paris. Overall we were very satisfied with our stay and we would choose this hotel again for an stay in Paris. LOCATION: is quite near from Trocadero, best point to see Eiffel Tower. The street is very quiet and the area is elegant and seems quite safe. We came by car and it was easy to park (it was august, month when it is free and plenty of space). HOTEL: it looks very new, functional and modern. Rooms are a bit small, but they look very clean, elegant, modern and have all amenities you need (only no minibar). Bathroom size is ok, bathtub should have more functional courtains to avoid spilling water. There is flat TV and free WIFI. Staff was friendly and helpful. BREAKFAST: overall is was very good quality, with fresh juices, good bread & cakes, excellent cheese, ham, cold meat, fruit, scrambled eggs, yogurts, ... we only miss more warm food like sausages, bacon, ... but we were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “All round excellence”
Reviews.Author: jogreatbatch
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we could not fault this excellent hotwl in any way.Although the rooms can be on the small side, a feature of Paris hotels, it was excellent all round. The hotel staff were some of the best and friendliest I have ever met and the breakfasts could not be bettered. Would I recommend this hotel, yes, would I stay here again, you bet. Only 5 mins from the Trocadero and 10 mins to the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: elegik
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, in great location. Beautiful interior, small but comfortable rooms. Helpful people. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andunderry
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my wife to Paris for a short break for her 40th birthday and looked at hundreds of hotels. I decided on the Plaza Tour Eiffel and it was an excellent choice. The staff are brilliant and are only too willing to help you. We were upgraded to a superior room on our arrival at no extra cost and they insisted on taking our luggage to the room. The room and bathroom were extremely clean. There was no noise from other guests and the hotel allowed for a very relaxing break. The breakfast was more than enough. The hotel is only a 10 minute stroll form the Eiffel Tower. If I return to Paris I will not be looking at any other hotels as this one was perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Paris location”
Reviews.Author: UrbanAngel5
Reviews.Content: This was a great wee hotel. It was clean and modern and comfortable. The staff were great and the service was excellent. They were very helpful and had excellent English. Unfortunately the location of this hotel was not the best. It was near the Eiffel Tower, we could see the top of the Tower if we leaned out the window, but it was still a bit of a walk even from that. The hotel was not near the Champs Elysees really at all, nor any of the museums, shops, etc. We also struggled to find anywhere nice to eat near the hotel. We weren't being fussy either. The first night we wandered round the streets near the hotel and ended up in this place where they gave us pre made spag bol heated up in the microwave. Its Paris! We didn't go there to get reheated spaghetti! The hotel is a bit out of the way, on a corner of two wee streets. We were in a few taxis coming back from various places and they all struggled to find the hotel. I think that's a bad sign. Lovely hotel but unfortunately the location really let it down and next time I'm in Paris I will definitely not be staying there or anywhere near.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: osubux1
Reviews.Content: This was a 4 day trip to Paris and the first for me. Picked this hotel due to Trip Advisor reviews and they were accurate. This hotel is wonderful. Some points: -The service is out of this world. Sophie and Daniel are top notch and are two of the top hotel employees we've ever encountered. They and the others delivered on every single request we asked for... and with a smile. I can honestly say it has been a long time since we've experienced such outstanding service anywhere in the world. -The area is not known for nightlife, so if that is what you want, you may try elsewhere. It is a great, quiet neighborhood with a fantastic fresh produce/fruit market steps away, a natural food market next to it (for wine, etc.). It is approximately a half mile walk to the Trocadero with its cafe's all around, and the Tower another half mile. The Trocadero has a metro stop as well, so that was convenient. Very safe area. -The wi fi worked perfectly, the breakfast buffet was very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Began with Queen Mary 2 ended with Plaza Tour Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: CalinCa
Reviews.Content: Our two-month European holiday began with passage from NYC on the QM2 and ended with a stay at PTE. Neither the QM2 nor the PTE disappointed. The Plaza is a charming small hotel located away from the bustle of the tourist areas and yet no more than a 5 minute walk to a Metro stop and the Trocadero. Although all rooms faced the street, Rue Greuze is not heavily trafficked and the soundproofing superb (our room was on the first level (US 2nd floor). Bedding was excellent, bathroom fresh and spotless. Staff at PTE were no less wonderful than those on the QM2. Within short walks, several patisseries (the best for us-- corner Rue Longchamps and Avenue Victor Hugo) and good not fine restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Paris: Unexpected pleasure!!”
Reviews.Author: tanmann
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, and my first trip to Europe. We were booked through "AvantiTravel" into the Plaza Tour Eiffel. This was truly an uxepected pleasure. The front desk staff could not have been more accommodating, especially Sophie and George. Their understanding, personal attention, and professionalism were greatly appreciated. They personally helped dispel some of thenegative stereotypes of the European service industry. Our room was tastefully modern and very comfortable. We were off the noisy "main drag", but near enough to walk to a bus or the Metro for our sightseeing needs. Keep up the good work!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Maryjpark
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Use of computers .A 5-10 minute walk to the Metro and restaurants. We loved the little Brassiere across the street from the hotel and a Pattissere next door. You do have to walk aways to eat. A little noisy if AC not on and windows open.

Reviews.Title: “Bit overpriced but great location”
Reviews.Author: LadyWotLunches
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights at the beginning and end of our trip to the south of France. I e-mailed the hotel directly (using my best French!) to find out availability and they came back with a cost per night that was half that of the prices being advertised on all the usual websites, including the hotel's own site. This could be an excellent way of getting a good rate for a hotel that would otherwise be really overpriced. The location however is next to none. Coming out of the nearest metro station to the hotel, you're confronted by the view of the Eiffel Tower which was brilliant. There's a little bar across the road (which does shut very early) and a lovely patisserie and cafe for the full French breakfast experience on the street heading left out of the hotel. All in all, it was a pleasant stay at this hotel (staff were brilliant) but just try and get the best deal that you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sneha23
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 2 nights and have no faults with the place! It's in a great location - 10-15mins walk to the Eiffel Tower, 5 minutes walk to Trocadero Metro station and near some great bars, cafes and restaurants. Sophie welcomed us when we arrived and suggested an excellent order to see the sights we wanted to see given we only had 2 full days to see a lot. Sophie also recommended a restaurant to eat in the night we arrived (Jamin nearby) - she also made a reservation for us whilst we dumped our bags. I have seen comments that say the rooms are small - we found that there was plenty of space to walk around and put our bag down etc (we had a standard room) - also what more do you want when you just need a base to stay in and will be mostly out and about seeing the sights? We didn't eat breakfast here - Sophie also suggested some restaurants for brunch when she knew we wanted to eat out rather than in the hotel. The hotel is in a nice and quiet location despite being so close to a main road and metro station etc. If we go back to Paris we'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Okay sums it up”
Reviews.Author: scholnicks
Reviews.Content: Plaza Tour Eiffel is a nice modern hotel in a quiet Paris neighborhood. Despite the name it is not close to the Eiffel Tower (a 15 minute walk). Yes it is close to Trocadero metro stop but that is about it. There are some nice cafes/restaurants in the area. We did not try the breakfast buffet (it cost 18 euros, way over priced. Go next door to the tasty bakery). The room is very very small, barely bigger than a cruise cabin. The bathroom is tiny, and the shower is a joke. It barely functions as a shower. Despite going in April, it was quite hot in Paris (>75F every day). Our air conditioning was set on 17C (~ 63F), but it was not cooling the small room at all. We had to open the window and run the air to get any kind of relief. The staff is very friendly and the they all spoke excellent English. The free wifi was stable and easy to use from our iPhones. Be warned check in time is 2 PM.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....but I can't wait for the Euro rate to go up..!”
Reviews.Author: HollyLovesMrTumble
Reviews.Content: Like the vast majority of previous reviewers I found it difficult to fault anything about the Plaza and I'm so pleased I always take the time to look at this site before I book anything. I know we can't always have the same taste but there were so many positives that it seemed a bit of a no-brainer. It was clear from the welcome that we received that service is a top priority. Sophie welcomed us and although we were early she kept our luggage and then gave us a map and advised us on how to get around. The tube map can look very intimidating at first but its just as easy as the London Undergound once you've been on it a couple of times and the service is really quick and the stops seem to be so close together you can move about town really quickly. This will sound a bit repetitive but, as the others have said, the hotel is 2 minutes from the Trocadero station which is also 3 stops from the Arc De Triomphe. We also went to Sacre Coeur and Montmartre both of which are unmissable and also only about 20 minutes or so away on the Metro. As we were only away for a long weekend it was difficult to see all the sights but we got a boat trip in and a trip to Notre Dame but missed out on seeing Versailles which my wife hasn't visited before. Breakfast in the hotel is plentiful; meat, cheese and a variety of cereals and yogurts plus a hot tray with bacon and scrambled egg. Again, service was always very polite and efficient. We had a deluxe room and expected it to be slightly small, as all European cities tend to be, but we spent little time in it anyway. It was still decorated and furnished very tastefully and the bed was extremly comfortable. I must echo the 'shower' problem. Its difficult to imagine how anyone came up with this concept but you should just acknowledge that you will be better off holding it rather than take the chance of swimming back to the bedroom...!! A special mention to Sophie on reception who was possibly the friendliest member of staff I have come across and it makes such a difference to be welcomed so warmly every time you enter the hotel. Overall, whilst I couldn't really fault the hotel, Paris is a very expensive place to stay. Most places we visited charged around £2.50 for a coke, £4 for a coffee and between £6.50-7.50 for a bottle of beer. It was clearly a more reasonable place to stay when the Euro was up at around 1.50 to the pound but at the moment you don't get a lot for your money...! If I did visit again though I would definitely use/recommend the Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert_29
Reviews.Content: Don't really write reviews for hotels but Stayed at the Plaza Tour Eiffel and I'm compelled to share my experience so that others can benefit from this top little hotel. Its walking distance to both the Eiffel tower and the Arc de Triumph and there really is no need to get cabs anywhere as a; they cost a fortune trying to navigate round the hideous roads of Paris and b; because you have a metro station on your doorstep (Tracadero). I phoned the hotel upon arriving at Charles De Gaulle and they talked me through how to get a train to them, again saving us a fortune in unnecessary cabs. The next day the helpful staff, whom I’m sure if I’d of asked them would of polished my shoes whilst making me a cup of tea and ironing my shirt, advised me to take the metro round the city and the receptionist even walked me to the shop to help buy my metro tickets... how many hotels would even bother, they would just get you a cab as it’s easier for them! The hotel is small and far from palatial but you don't come to Paris to sit in your room. It has everything you need, free wifi which worked perfectly with my Iphone, tidy, clean comfortable rooms in a central location. Don't bother blowing hundreds of pounds on some flash gaff, go here. I would recommend dinner at Le Coq, just round the corner, the snails are awesome. In a city that is full of somewhat rude, grumpy Parisians who's frosty hospitality can often be the accepted norm this hotel offered a refreshing opposite to the stereotype you come to expect. Go here, you would have to be super picky to fault it, and that's coming from someone with OCD.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Service”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is committed to service. I've never received this level of service in France at this price range of hotel. The employees are very friendly and willing to go the extra mile for you. A very professional staff. The only negative would be the shower. It is difficult to wash your hair without getting water everywhere. So make sure you don't bring your dry clean clothes in the bathroom with you. I would absolutely stay here again as it is a very well appointed hotel with an outstanding staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice secluded hotel in residential area”
Reviews.Author: jacobsterner
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel in quiet neighbourhood. Very friendly and helpful staff! Close to metro (Trocadero), otherwise cheap enough to take taxi wherever we were going in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Plaza Tour Eiffel - April 2009”
Reviews.Author: SamrahQ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an ideal location. The closest Metro station was 5 minutes walk and the Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe were all within 10 minutes walk. The hotel staff were very helpful in places to go and where to eat and taking care of you during your stay. Buffet breakfast was yummy, a good selection for everyone (especially me as i'm not keen on red meat, which seems to be everywhere in Paris) and the staff serve you hot beverages and food is warm. i would definitely stay here again and have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: TX2theworld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a (first-time) short trip to Paris. We found the Plaza Tour Eiffel online at Hotels.com and the great price (considering the awesome location!) is what sealed the deal for us. The staff was super friendly, and the front desk guys spoke very good English. The hotel was clean, modern, and so quiet- which was a welcome evening respite from noisy streets, trains, shops and restaurants all day long. Good breakfast- ours was included...check your reservation for that. TIP> there is also a fantastic bakery (open M-F) right next door! The hotel staff were able to recommend fantastic restaurants (authentically French) and really answered all of our questions with much more grace and tolerance than anyone else we met in Paris. This hotel is only a 5-10 minute walk from the Trocodero and Metro- which is also directly across the Seine from the Eiffel Tower. The tower is visible just a block from the hotel. Surprisingly, for being so close to everything, i will say again that the neighborhood is so quiet. It is quite likely that we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, modern hotel with a wonderful staff in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: DiMontebello
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just two nights while traveling Europe, but wish we could have stayed longer. Very hip, modern hotel without being pretentious. Located on a quiet street just off the Trocadero (four minute walk). We stayed on the fourth floor in a deluxe room that we could see the Tour Eiffel from if we leaned out the window a bit. We booked last minute so we didn't expect a higher floor with a great view, but I honestly have NO complaints about the room location or view! For a deluxe room it was small, but I know that's what to expect. I've been to enough European hotels to know. I'm afraid to see what a classic or superior room looked like though! Bathroom was a good size, lovely beveled subway tile, modern sink and amenities. Nice closet with robes and slippers. We had a space just for luggage, and there was a desk and a second sitting area. Nice flat screen TV, though only two channels in English. No biggie. Bed was comfortable and the pillows were giant fluffy clouds... The lobby was beautiful and is where they have a little bar for drinks or tea and a nice sitting area with lots of books. No mini-bar in the rooms, so this is the alternative. My wife got some wine while we relaxed before leaving for our flight and they brought it to us and gave us a little bowl of chips. Very nicely done. Breakfast room is very nice as well. Nice little continental selection. It was included and it was a nice start to the day. Decorated so nice we are going to mimic the style in our front hallway! The hotel is located about a ten minute walk to the Eiffel and about 20 minute to the Arc. A Metro stop is right at the Trocadero and the system gets you EVERYWHERE. We caught a double decker tour bus for 24 euro per person and it's good for two days. It beings you to the Louvre, Grand Palais, Eifel, Arc, Champs, etc. Good way to get around for a short trip to see some major sights. Ok....on to the personnel. Just like everyone else, we got nothing but OUTSTANDING service from the people here. The woman that first checked us in (sorry for forgetting her name) was a pleasure and extremely helpful. she made some nice dinner recommendations based on my wife's craving for a fancy French duck diner. They all went out of their way to speak English, give us directions and suggestions. Daniel helped us at the front desk and with our bags. Always smiling and very friendly. George went absolutely OUT of his way to help us. He was getting off work when we were headed to a shuttle bus a way's away to get out to the Beauvais airport, and he took us on the tram and the RER train line to our stop and even helped pay for our tickets!! What hotel would EVER have a staff member go out of their way like that?? NONE. Enough cannot be said for the graciousness of the staff here. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for anyone who wanted to stay in this area of Paris near the Tour Eiffel and wanted a quiet, extremely clean and modern hotel with amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: RonNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. We planned to stay 3 nights and ended up staying 7. The hotel is in an upscale residential neighborhood. The rooms are newly renovated, clean and stylish. The best part of this gem of a small hotel , however, is the staff who are courteous and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: nzamy
Reviews.Content: I returned for my second stay (first in June 2009), both for work so had no choice in where I was staying - but was a good location for me as I had to attend the OECD each day, but perhaps not the best location for tourists. In saying that however, 5-10 mins to the Eiffel Tower, and 15 or so minutes to Arc de Triomphe and Champs de Elysse. Plus 3 minutes to the Troccadero metro and you're off really. Also has lots of nice wee places to eat around the hotel (excluding the Troccadero eateries, which are busy, but overpriced. Look down side streets for nicer places). Excellent and friendly service. Didn't eat at the hotel for breakfast (and no fridge in room) but an excellent pastry shop right next door. Rooms are small, but comfortable beds, free wifi, flat screen tv, and good storage. Bathrooms are awful - very modern but the way the shower is set up it completely floods the room each time you have a shower, so I had to always move all my bathroom stuff off the shelf as otherwise it would get wet, and use a towel to cover the floor and toilet to avoid them becoming completely wet. If that could be fixed it would be a lot better! Would recommend this hotel based on friendly service, quiet and safe neighbourhood, and pretty comfortable rooms. However if you want to be a bit closer to the action perhaps this won't be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern hotel. Great, friendly staff in a residential area. Close proximity to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: WestBayBanjo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights. The Plaza Tour Eiffel is located within a 5 minute walk from the Trocadero metro stop. It's also conveniently located within walking distance from the Eiffel Tower. There's a great pastry store right next to the hotel, and there are numerous restaurants and cafes within walking distance. First off, the staff was very friendly and welcoming. Everyone spoke english and were very willing to help us with any questions we had. They helped us get reservations at L'Epi Dupin, which was/is a great experience. The room was just as advertised here on TA. The bed was very comfortable, free wireless access, and AC. The bathroom was modern but small. We didn't spend much time in the room since we were out all day. But, it was definitely a comfortable room to be able to relax and rest after a long day of activities. I'd highly recommend this hotel if you enjoy staying away from the touristy areas of the city. The 16th district is a little bit far away from the center of the city (like 1/2 hour metro ride with transfers), but if you're okay with that, this is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean & Comfortable Rooms and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Chillhawk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great proximity to Metro, restaurants and a short walk to the Eiffel Tower. Staff was very pleasant. Rooms were small but bed and pillows were very comfortable. Quaint area was quiet but yet only a few minutes from the Trocadero metro stop. Had a great time with a wonderful tour guide, my daughter who had just spent 6 weeks in an university abroad program and couldn't have enjoyed Paris more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff & Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chasbee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Plaza Tour Eiffel for 3 nights in Mid-July as part of a Eurostar package and chose this hotel from the many on offer, our choice based on the reviews on trip advisor. We arrived at Gare Du Nord from St Pancras ( We had purchased Paris Metro tickets at the Eurostar Terminal St Pancras) and travelled on the Paris Metro to the Trocadero, the hotel is no more than a 3/4 minute walk from the Trocadero metro station. We arrived before the scheduled check-in time but were allowed access to our room on the 4th Floor. The room was clean, fresh and well furnished, after all when you are on a visit to Paris very little time is spent in the room other than for sleeping and showering. As others have said the shower heads do need to be carefully directed if you are not to spray the floor. ( We had used the toiletries after the 2nd day but they were not replenished, we bought our own) Apart from this minor gripe we had no complaints. The bed and pillows were clean and very comfortable making for a good nights sleep after a hard day trekking the streets of Paris. The air conditioning worked very well and we were able to return to a nice cool room during what was very warm spell of weather. The hotel is well placed and we managed to walk to most of the tourist sites without too much effort,(eg the Eiffel Tower can be reached in about 5-6 minutes) we heard no noise from the streets or indeed from other guests on the corridors. All staff were extremely polite and helpful and a credit to the hotel. The provision of their own map of places to see/eat with an idea of the budget required was very useful as was the wider map of Paris given to us on check in. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment. We took breakfast at a nearby brassierie within a minute of the hotel at the Place de Mexico which was very good value for money. We tended to eat in little bistros or brasseries in side streets as these were considerably better value than those located around the Trocadero who charged a lot more for food, beer and wine. Overall if you are looking for some where clean and comfortable in a good location then I wouldn't look for anywhere else. We would readily return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shellclan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here and found it to be a wonderful experience. From the moment we arrived, we were instantly helped with luggage from the very friendly and helpful staff. (Here's to you Daniel and Mohammed!) It is a short walk down the street to the Trocadero where you have a spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower. My adult children and I had no problems at night walking here. There is a great boulangerie (bakery) next door and a wonderful grocery/shopping area just down the street. Just ask the front desk, they will let you know. The rooms are lovely, free wi-fi and nice flat screen tv. The bathroom shower/tub is a bit small but I found that to be the case in Spain as well. I will definitely stay here again when I return!

Reviews.Title: “Okay.”
Reviews.Author: EUEx-pat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Plaza Tour Eiffel for 2 nights in April 2009. We (my boyfriend and I) were in Paris for the long weekend and this was our fourth time to this city and we really haven’t found a hotel in Paris that we would come back to so we decided to give this one a try based on the reviews on TA. Transportation We drove to Paris for the weekend. We parked on the street through the advice of the hotel staff. There were no signs forbidding parking or any signs indicating anything of that nature and needless to say…we got towed on our second day. We know from experience there is no such thing as free parking but we paid the price anyway. Getting our car back was a surprisingly painless process. It is much cheaper to park in the nearby garage Ave Foch. We walked around the city for the rest of our stay and used the metro twice (stations Trocadero or Passy). Neighborhood The hotel is in a residential area and not near any of the main tourist attractions. It seemed to be safe as we walked back to the hotel at night. The metro stations are about a 10 minute walk if you have to go further. Great views of the Eiffel Tower are nearby. The location was ideal as this was a return trip to Paris for us but we wouldn’t have chosen it for our first time here. Room (photos included) We had a standard double room and our rate was €162 as an average per night for the weekend (including breakfast). We booked the hotel through the hotel website. The room was small and the décor was modern. The bed was a queen size and comfortable. The room was equipped with a desk, chair, TV, safe and wardrobe. No fridge was in the room. The room was on the warm side due to unexpected temperature for April and the air conditioner did not help keep it cool – we opened the windows and that helped. Bathroom (photos included) The bathroom was white tiled and modern – photos of it look great but you can tell it is cheaply built. Our bathroom had a shower/tub combination. The bathroom included toiletries and a hair dryer as well. The bathroom was clean. On the outside wall of the bathroom there seemed to be water damage to the wall (see photo). Amenities/Service We did have breakfast one morning. The breakfast was continental with breads, jams, cereal and juice. It was very good. The hotel staff was very nice and when our car got towed they did help us write a letter of contest in French to see if we could get our money back – we didn’t get it back. Overall the hotel was suitable for what we wanted. I give it a rating of three because of the wall damage and there was nothing beyond what we expected. It was just an okay stay with the unexpected high fee for parking!

Reviews.Title: “You pay the price for a great location”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTraveler0807
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the hotel during a two-week European vacation. I had very mixed feelings about the hotel. It has a fantastic location. You are a block from Tracadero and only 2 blocks from the Eiffel Tower. However, the rooms looked worn and the room seemed expensive in comparison to what we received. In the end the wonderful staff and great location won me over on the hotel. After having a travel nightmare trying to get into Paris, we were greeted by a wonderful staff. We flew into CDG at 9 PM. Little did I know that we were flying into Terminal 3, a small charter terminal. We walked over Terminal 2. I must admit we were not very prepared for our arrival. I didn’t have any Euros at this point because we had flown in from Prague, and we thought we could get a better exchange rate in the Paris airport. However, the only exchange place open was back in Terminal 3. We decided not to walk back there. I assumed it would be easy to catch a cab, but the only option there was the train or metro. We decided it would be easiest just to get on the metro since we had a metro map in our travel guide, but we didn’t have any info on the train. I’m sure the train would have been faster, but it took us an hour and one transfer to get to the hotel (while lugging around 2 big suitcases and 2 carry-ons). Once we got to the Tracadero stop, we weren’t sure which direction to go to the hotel (it is down the street to the left of the row of cafés facing Tracadero). Once we got to the hotel, I realized I had only booked the room for one person. The staff was great! There wasn’t any problem adding my husband to the room. I also had them arrange for a car to pick us up to take us back to the airport. I was not about to try the metro again with the suitcases. We rode in a nice Mercedes taxi with a friendly driver. We chose not to pay the 18 Euros a person for breakfast. I wanted to try as many restaurants and café’s in Paris as possible during our 3-day trip. I discovered a wonderful bakery right next door to the hotel. We would grab a croissant in the morning then walk to Tracadero to take our daily picture in front of the Eiffel Tower. I thought if we took a picture each day, we would have at least one good one. Also, previous reviews mentioned a supermarket down the street from the hotel. We saw several small markets, so we thought we found it. On our last day there, we found the actual supermarket. If you take a left out of the hotel, and go around the round-a-bout so you stay on the same street there will be a shopping center down on your left. There was a supermarket and a Paul bakery. We got a wonderful snack and some well priced wines from there. There is not a corkscrew in the room, so we just bought one at the market. We couldn’t find one in any of the other shops around the hotel. Do be warned that the stores around the hotel are very expensive. Our taxi driver told us that we were in a very ritzy part of Paris. There were a ton of embassies and nice homes. Also, the hotel is difficult for taxi drivers to find. We would just tell them to drop us off at Tracadero, and walk the rest of the way to the hotel. We did some of the usual tourist things. We went to the Louvre. I had bought tickets online about two weeks before our trip. There was enough time to have them delivered to my house, and it saved us a wait in a long line. We walked to the Louvre from the hotel. It only took about 20 minutes. We had a nice stroll along the river and through the Place de la Concorde and Tuileries Gardens. The museum was very crowded so we only went through a few rooms and saw the Mona Lisa and Venus de Milo. After leaving the museum, we had my favorite meal of the entire trip. We went to Angelia. It’s a tea house on the Rue de Rivoli. It’s only a few minute walk from the Louvre. I had a wonderful quiche, and the best hot chocolate I’ve ever tasted. My husband and I shared a small pot of chocolate and their signature desert called a Mont Blanc. It was more than the two of us could eat. One last warning on the hotel. I never considered showering an Olympic sport until I stayed here. The bathrooms are very modern. We had a showerhead like I had never seen before. It was tall and thin, and the water pressure would cause it to turn. This would not have been a problem, but in every European hotel we stayed in there was only a small glass door that was attached to the wall and no shower curtain. This one had the smallest door of them all. We would drench the bathroom every morning. Since the hotel only provided two towels, this made for an interesting morning. The hotel also provided a computer with free internet in the lobby and L'Occtaine bath products.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic position”
Reviews.Author: ErikG
Reviews.Content: We travelled by eurostar and arrived at Gare du Nord, from there a 2 min walk over to Gare du L'est to catch the number 30 bus which goes to Trocadero which is a couple of minutes walk to the hotel. Very easy trip and cost all of €3.20 for both of us. We booked through Expedia so not sure of the room designation but presuming it was a standard room it was very nice, if not a bit small but since we were out all day it was absoulutely fine. There is working quiet air con, a safe but no mini bar or coffee making facilities, we always take our own travel kettle as that seems the norm in most hotels these days, the other half does like her morning cuppa! We had a complementary bottle of water in our room, we found a selection of shops next to the hotel to get other water, fruit etc. Room was always cleaned and re supplied each day and the bed was very comfortable, we slept very well, though I'm sure walking round Paris, eating fab food and drinking loads of wine may have had something to do with it. We just had the express breakfast they serve in the foyer which was all we wanted and cheaper than the full breakfast, coffee/tea, small croissants & pain au chocolate, orange juice, tasty and enough to keep you going til lunch. Staff were very friendly and helpful and all spoke good english. We arrive early and they were happy to keep our bags safe till we could check in, as they were to let us leave them the day we checked out to pick up later, inc using the washroom. There is no lounge as such, the reception doubles up as the bar, though there is a small seating area you can use to read, have the express breakfast or just a drink. Some free newspapers are available and also there is a free PC for internet access. There are shops locally, a bakers next door, fruit shop 20 metres, pharmacy etc etc all very near. Bus and Metro stops very close (couple of mins by foot ), as is the Eiffel Tower (5 mins), Champs Elysee / Arc du triomphe (5 Mins).... great position. We would deffinatley recommend this Hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, quiet location, great breakfast, good restaurants close by”
Reviews.Author: sportycouple
Reviews.Content: Arrived at CdeG airport. RER Train to Denfert-Rochereau station and Metro 6 to Trocadero. 8 minute walk to Hotel. Metro 9 from same station for Roland Garros Tennis. All very easy. Total cost from airport to Hotel 10 euros. We stayed in a deluxe double room that was very nice and had all we needed. No mini bar or coffee making facilities but that does seem the norm for a lot of Paris hotels. Small bottle of water bought from reception was 4 euros so best to buy your own and bring with you. Sheets changed each day and bed was very comfortable. No complaints whatsoever. Breakfast was very good and excellent choice including bacon/scarmbled egg as well as croissants, ham, cheese, bread, juices, cerials, fruit, etc. All you would expect Staff all spoke good english and very polite and attentive. Gave good directions to get to the hotel and knew of some very good restaurants nearby. No Evening Meals at the Hotel. We ate in a typical french restaurant one night recommended by Hotel that worked out at approx 50 euros per head and was superb french cuisine. 5 mins walk from Hotel and away from normal tourist area. No lounge as such as reception really doubles up with a very small lounge seating area but we did not need this as we were out all the time. 3 Banks within 2 mins walk so cash machines readiliy available. Also a good Bakers one minute from hotel so if you need to stock up with food for the day then it is ideal. You could walk to Eiffel Tour and elsewhere if you were energetic. Otherwise Metro at 1.5 euros per trip was very easy. We would recommend this Hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again. We had 3 nights. It is not on a main road so very little traffic noise. As far as we were concerned - couple mid 50's - absloutely ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location & staff”
Reviews.Author: shelleypa
Reviews.Content: Just back from Paris -this hotel is just as described. Excellent location, close to attractions & metro but in a quiet neighborhood setting. The rooms are small (expected in Paris) but beautiful with modern bathrooms and L'occitane bath products. The staff could not have been more accomodating and helpful and all spoke excellent English. Loved eating in the recommended restaurants a very short walk away. Breakfast is included and was suprisingly good (they even had scrambled eggs -unusual in Paris), served in a lovely dining area. Included wi-fi. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: chic0ze
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris. I have chosen this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and on a quick websearch for good prices. I arrived to the airport Charles de Gaulle and my initial plan was to take the train to Paris. The queue was so long to buy the train tickets that probably would have taken more time than the flight itself. I decided to go by taxi, which, at the end, came at 42 EUR. Someone called this a "boutique hotel" which is probably a good review. The hotel is small and rooms are small as well, and you will find it difficult to sleep together with your luggage which you will probably try to stuck it under the table next to the tv. No minibar in inside the room where I stayed. Now for the good things> Great location 5 minutes from Trocadero, in a quite area (the 16th district iis THE district in Paris) Reasonable breakfast with delicious croissants and orange juicei Free wireless connection to the internet Friendly staff As you will not spend too much time in the hotel, as Paris has unlimited offers and possibilities for everything this hotel is a very good value for money I would highly recommended it to everyone staying 3 or 4 days in Paris!! I loved beautiful Paris! Great food!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 5EI8008
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was most excellent. The sharply dressed staff were very professional, very knowledgeable about restaurants and attractions (wish I could remember the young man's name we spoke with every morning - he was really helpful and spoke perfect English), and were all very courteous and cheerful. We were always warmly greeted upon entry, champagne was delivered promptly when ordered, and I can't speak highly enough about the level of service at this hotel. The hotel is only about an six minute walk from the subway station (at the Trocadero), and located on a quiet side street in a nice neighborhood close to the main hustle and bustle of the Trocadero (pretty much an ideal location). Plenty of restaurants and a small market were also within a short walk. The room itself was very modern, everything felt very new and meticulously cleaned, and was very comfortable and spacious by European standards. We had a corner room three floors directly over the entrance, so we had a nice view of the (fairly quiet) intersection below from the huge window. The amenities were very nice, our room refreshed and straightened daily, and the bed and pillows very comfortable. A complimentary bottle of water awaited our arrival the first afternoon, which was a nice touch. Breakfast was always good, and we even enjoyed mingling with the other guests (who also seemed to be enjoying their stay - Hello again to the ladies from the Newseum in DC!) Overall, this was a very clean, well maintained, ideal hotel to stay at. I would highly recommend it to others, and will look for it again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Boutique Parisien Hotel With Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ubizydotcom
Reviews.Content: Would like a hotel 5 mins from the Eiffel tower? Would you like a boutique hotel at 3 star prices? Would you like superior service? Would you like a hotel where you would want to visit paris over and over again? We stayed here on Sat 2nd May to Tues 5th May. Thanks to the reviews on tripadvisor! Sophie on reception was so friendly, warm, but most of all informative. Our room had a view of the Eiffel Tower! Ive been all over the world, and always look for a fabulous hotel...but more importantly... location and value for money Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Live Up To Its Billing”
Reviews.Author: whachmacallit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights in April; the interior was overheated and the AC did not work. We slept with our one window open but were awakened early every morning by the noise of daily garbage collection. Our "Deluxe Room with sitting area" was a joke! There was a single straight backed chair shoved into a corner with a cheap table the size of a pregnant pizza pan, blocking the only mirror and preventing us from opening the window. We'd hit our shins on it unless we shoved it under the desk. For this we were charged an extra 22 euros per night. The staff was friendly but gave us bum directions to the RER station for a Versailles excursion. The desk clerk also failed to tell us until check-out that breakfast had been included in our room rate--too bad, too late! They had told our booking agency, Hotels.com, that breakfast would be an extra 15 euros per person/day so we ate there only once. I had even sent a fax inquiry before departure, but the hotel never responded. The hotel fails to list a phone number anywhere in their internet material. They did charge us 4.50 euros per cup for coffee at the reception desk. We had read a guest comment in TripAdvisor that the coffee at the desk was complimentary. Don't believe it. The bathroom was all style and no function. The lighting and mirror were poorly placed so hubby needed binoculars to see how to shave and I couldn't get close enough to see the back of my head even with a hand mirror. The shower looked sleek and chic but always got the floor wet and didn't spray very well. The hot water ran out and my shower turned cold one morning at 8:30 a.m. Two people can't fit in the bathroom at the same time, unless one stands in the tub, and you can't reach the towel rack without closing the door. The floor was sticky our first night, so I washed it with the tub mat. Storage space in the room was crappy--no drawers at all in the room or bathroom and the closet was cramped. But, the bed was comfortable and internet was gratis. Had this place not been billed as #19 out of more than 1000 Paris hotels on Trip Advisor, I would have said it was ok for a Paris hotel. But with such a high rating, we expected more and it certainly did not deliver!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful botique hotel, great staff, quiet neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: flyjets
Reviews.Content: A great hotel (about 43 rooms) very close walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and the Seine. Located in a very quiet residential neighborhood, but close to small shops and restaurants and the Trocadero. Easy walk to the Arch de Triumph and The Champs-Elysees. Metro station is less than a five minute walk and easy access to CDG airport. Free wifi throughout hotel, nice fitness room, but more importantly a great and helpful staff that speak excellent English. We originally planned to try some other hotels, in other locations, during our 10 day trip, but the hotel and staff met our needs and we didn't want to be disappointed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Armonk
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 just finished a four night stay in two rooms at this hotel. We were very pleased. The staff was consistently very helpful and kind to us -- and we asked MANY questions, all in English. They answered all my emails before I arrived and made reservations for us at a couple of restaurants -- one was particularly special. We left behind an item of jewelry and they called us en route to the airport to let us know they had found it and then shipped it to us promptly. I am very grateful to them for their gracious hospitality to us throughout the entire stay. The rooms were small but had everything one could want. The beds were very comfortable. The shower enclosure is small by US standards but one can figure out quickly how to position oneself and the shower nozzle to avoid splattering the room with water so it was not uncomfortable. I will say that the street outside our room was noisier early on the weekday mornings than I had expected from the reviews. I recommend keeping the windows shut on weeknights. On weekend nights the street was very quiet. The hotel serves a very satisfactory full breakfast for 15 euros and there are multiple decent alternatives within a 5 minute walk if one desires a change. That is true for lunch and dinner as well ( the hotel does not serve either but will arrange for a local deli to deliver items to your room). The hotel is on a corner (rue Greuze and rue Sablons) in an otherwise residential area, a five minute walk from the Trocadero, where there are several museums and a Metro stop for the 6 and 9 lines, and most of all, at the Trocadero, one is just across the Seine from the Eiffel Tower. Then, about 20 minutes in the opposite direction is the Arc du Triomphe and the beginning of the Champs Elysees. The hotel called taxis for us regularly and they arrived within a few minutes. If you do not speak French well, I recommend taking something with the hotel's address on it as it is not a well-known street. So I definitely recommend this and hope you find this review helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lilly57
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Paris, we chose this hotel after reading the reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. The hotel is clean, staff friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good with a good variety of breads/cereal/fruit to choose from, and a few hot cooked items as well. The room we were given was well furnished and comfortable, although a little small compared to rooms in other cities it was more than big enough for two. The location of the hotel was super, a short walk from the Trocadero with a good selection of restaurants to sample, and close to the Eiffel Tower. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a quiet section in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jewelSLC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay in Paris at the Plaza Tour Eiffel. I usually do not write reviews but the staff were so nice and helpful I thought it was necessary to let others know about this great hotel. The hotel is located about a ten minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and is in a very quiet part of Paris. It is a good break from the crowded streets at many of the city sights. The rooms are very clean and modern. The room we stayed in was a typical Paris hotel room size but it was comfortable and we had a view of the tower from our window. The staff are very helpful and polite. All speak English and do not seem to mind multiple questions and requests. We particularly appraciated Daniel, Mohammad and Sophie. I would definately reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staying with the Residents in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MTNester1957
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, and we only had 3 days. I wanted to find someplace special that wouldn't cost us our house! After reading the reviews here, I was fairly confident that we had found the right place....and we did. When we visti other countries, we prefer to stay in places that will allow us to experience a piece of native life....the Plaza Tour Eiffel does that. The hotel is located in an upscale residential area. At 8 AM, watch the mothers and fathers walking their children to school; by 10 AM the older women are walking to the markets. If you head towards the Trocadera, you will pass the Thailand and Spanish Embassies. If you head toward Place de Mexico, you'll pass a local bakery, boutiques and fresh fruit market. We spent every evening sipping wine and eating cheeses at the various bistros at the Trocadera which is a few minute walk from the hotel. There are very few tourists there (relatively speaking), and you'll find yourself immersed in French spoken with the speed of the TGV. (Although all the waitstaff spoke fluent english.) The hotel is lovely. The personnel are helpful in every way, taking our bags from the cabbie and to our room. Our plane came in early, and we were at the hotel at 10:30 AM. we fully expected to leave our bags there and check in later. However, they had a room ready for us which was a treat as we had just come in from the States and were fairly "fried". Our room was a bit small because we had a corner room over the front door, but it suited us fine. The bathroom was spotless, of a good size and has a good hairdryer in it! The storage is primarily in a wardrobe - and it did fit the clothing of two people with no problem. The bed was extremely comfortable, as were the pillows. We ended up leaving at 6 AM to catch a flight, and they offered to check us out the night before so we wouldn't be delayed, as well as arranged for a taxi which arrived right on time. Overall, it was a great place to stay...I would recommend it to everyone and anyone. Should we ever be able to return to Paris, I shall stay there again. FYI, the Metro is less than a 5 minute walk away, the Eiffel Tower takes 10-15 minutes to stroll, as does the Batabus, The Arc de Triomphe is about 40 minutes to walk to via the Avenue of New York next to the Seine. The cab fare from the airport was about 45 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: marypicc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three night in September with my daughter and niece. The Hotel Staff made us feel so welcome upon arrival and everyone speaks English. Stayed in the past at several other Hotels in Paris which I would never stay at again. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the beds were plush very much like our Wyndham Hotels here in the US. If you needed anything they were at your door immediately. This Hotel is in such a convenient safe area close to all the restaurants in Trocadero and the Eiffel Tower and also the Met. I was going next door to a cafe for coffee each day and been charged four euros, when the Hotel reminded me coffee is served there all day free of charge. The Front Desk Manager Kiran Rangoo was especially helpful when I had computer problems and was always willing to help despite the fact that he was very busy. Will definitely stay there again when I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean, modern & great staff. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: FPTC
Reviews.Content: We are a young Australian couple that got engaged during our trip to Paris. We upgraded to a Deluxe room for our stay. Our experience strongly supports the positive comments made by others. The hotel is located in a very clean, quiet and safe part of Paris. A local taxi driver described it as one of the best spots in the city. It is very close to the Eiffel Tower and within walking distance of public transport. The rooms are very clean and modern; they have obviously been refurbished recently. The bed and pillows were the most comfortable we experienced during our entire trip. Best of all, the staff were outstanding. They are very genuine and went out of their way to be helpful. We greatly appreciate their hospitality and would have no hesitation returning. This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bocagirl12
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four days in Paris and stayed at Plaza Tour Eiffel. The staff was so nice and helpful. The room was bigger than expected and so clean!! The bathroom was spotless everyday. The shower was a little strange but other than that I reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Definitive Review”
Reviews.Author: sacoffee
Reviews.Content: I guess the title is a little presumptuous but after reading the reviews on TA before we went I think I can help a little more with our review. We went with two other couples to Paris, this is our second trip and the first trip for the other two couples. I travel abroad extensively as part of my job and am accustomed to staying in 4 - 5 star hotels. So when we were looking into this trip I had to consider the other two couples and their spending limits ... so to the web we went. We looked at at least twenty different hotels, going back and forth on cost vs. features, reading every review we could, consulting a travel agent, etc. until we finally settled on the Tour Eiffel. Once the booking was complete I was never really sold as I know what European hotels are like and you typically get what you pay for. The 4-5 star hotels are very expensive but you get the amenities of large bathrooms, comfortable beds, in house resteraunt, room services, etc. Well knowing all this I was expecting the least from the Tour Eiffel, even though the reviews have been good on TA. Anyway, now to the review; we booked the Executive Suite and it is small but with a balcony, view of the Eiffel Tower (top half) we really enjoyed the room. The bed is large and very comfortable, the linens are fresh and crisp and the pillows are full and fluffy. The bath rooms are small. The showers have the half glass partition and it is difficult (no impossible) to take a shower without getting the bathroom all wet. The hot water ran out on me a couple of times during peak shower time (I guess 7-8 am) In other words the rooms are what you would expect for the price and size of this hotel. BUT; the location can not be beat. It is just off the beaten path and you should take a hotel business card with you to tell the cab drivers the address of the hotel. But the Trocedero Circle is about a 5 minute walk with a Metro station and Taxis stand. Right across the street from the circle is the promenade to the Eiffel Tower, about another 5-10 minute walk. We spent a lot of time in this area, laying on the lawn with our brown bags of wine, sandwiches and enjoyed the scenery and weather. The biggest part of this review is to comment on the service of the hotel; the Staff is genuinely friendly, helpful, courteous and professional. They went above and beyond to accommodate us and serve all of our needs. I must especially compliment the front desk staff for this. I bought my wife a dozen roses at a nearby flower shop (Place de Mexico) and as I was walking through the lobby they asked if I need a vase. It was brought to my room promptly with water and sugar for the roses. We asked for wine glasses on one occasions as all three couples met in our room and from then all we had fresh glasses every day. One Saturday night me and the other two men stayed in the lobby until 5 am listening to a College game, they never blinked an eye and kept the bar open for us all night. Anyway, I don't know what else to say to convince someone that this is a great hotel to stay at. If you want creature comforts and 5 star ambiance it is not for you. But if you want to be in the local crowd , close to the Eiffel Tower and receive excellent service then I highly recommend the Tour Effiel. FWIW; we are now at the Intercontinental Le Grand for the last five days of an 11 day trip, the service is not near what it was at this hotel. Other hints; De Vino on Plaza de Mexico is a very good restaurant. Nicolas (wine shop) is off the Place, third street on the left about 100 yds down in a little mall like area. Pataserier is across the hallway for good pastries and sandwiches. The Eiffel Tower restaurant Jules Verne is worth every penny. Normandy is a must see for Americans.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: DRMNSTR
Reviews.Content: I booked my boss into this hotel for one night, midway through a whirlwind business tour of Europe. From the reviews I had read it was a reasonably priced property in a good location with very friendly service and I was looking for an oasis in her travels. When my boss checked into the hotel after having spent a few days in back to back meetings in London this is what she had to say. OMG, Room is on tip top floor of front corner with balcony and I can see the tower! The staff practically tripped over themselves in an effort to help me - in a good way. Love this place! Would definitely book her again and recommend it to future colleagues visiting our Paris office.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ansh48
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, loved the L'occitane toiletries! Bit on the small side but central location made up for that. Good breakfast included. Only a couple of minutes walk to the Trocadero - fantastic views of the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault this hotel - loved it”
Reviews.Author: wheeler210
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day Paris break at this great hotel. We read lots reviews and were so pleased that we decided to choose this hotel. Stayed in a superior room which was just as described extremely clean and comfortable (clean towels every day and lovely L'Octane toiletries). The staff are v. friendly and helpful no matter what time of day. Had a deal where breakfast was included and it was v.good but not sure that we would have paid the going rate as there are places that are cheaper to eat. Great location just 5mins from metro and the busy Trocadero area that as lively cafes. Metro easy to negotiate and a quick and cheap way to travel, however for a more leisurely trip take the Batbus that travels down the river stopping at the main tourist spots (11Euros for a day ticket). I would recommend this hotel and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Zee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Paris for a week in this small but very pleasant Hotel, with very friendly and helpful staff. As already mentioned by many the rooms are indeed on the small side but comfortable, well decorated, clean and quiet. And with one of the best hotel beds I have ever slept on. Located in a quiet neighborhood but only a couple of minutes away of the Metro station, several bus stops, Car Rouges included, and nice restaurants. Several "must visit" reference points within walking distance (Trocadéro, Tour Eiffel, even the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysées). Breakfast was included, but this is the weak point of the Hotel, good enough but expensive and should be improved. Concluding: We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: tcyaya
Reviews.Content: this was a lovely little hotel. my daughter and I stayed here for 5 days. Breakfast was nothing to write home about and a little pricey - but other than that loved everything. Location is great - right around the corner from subway station - very close to the Eiffel Tower. they recommended a little restaurant for dinner - Sgabetti (hoped I spelled that correctly). Could be the best italian food I have ever had. Very close to the hotel - great decor - incredible food. We at there 2 nights we liked it so much. You can't go wrong with this hote or Sgabetti Restaurant!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ivan06
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. It was a short walk from the Eiffel Tower and from a subway station. The rooms were very clean, and I really liked the way they were decorated. There was also free wifi, a flat screen TV with a good selection of channels. The immediate neighborhood was nice and quiet, and as clean as most of Paris. The hotel staff was friendly, although a few staff members could've been a bit more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: frona
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel we stayed at whilst on our honeymoon to paris in july of this year. The hotel is ideally situated being very close to the Trocadero area. There are plenty of restuarants about five minutes walk away. The hotel itself is well appointed. The rooms are small, but this is usual for Paris. We really appreiated the air conditioning. The rooms were well decorated and clean as was the bathroom. These were serviced daily by friendly staff who really made an effort to communicate with you, even though they had little or no english. The area was very quiet and we were never distuburbed by either noise from in or outside the hotel. The reception staff were very helpful and the little bar was perfect for a night cap- and not badly priced compared to others. We would certainly recommend it and will use it again, when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandLouise
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, only a few minutes from Trocadero and Eiffel Tower. Well presented rooms though basic rooms are a little on the small side. Polite and helpful staff. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing All Round”
Reviews.Author: MariL
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a contemporarty Frech experience, however this could not have been further from the truth. Upon arrival my room was not ready, so I was taken upstairs to be taken back down again and given a glass of tapwater. I was downgraded to give me another room which was small, uncomfortable and badly decorated. The wallpaper was peeling from the walls, the curtains did not match the decor and the bathroom was not clean. There was also significant noise from the street, no mini bar and only one English TV channel (I know this is not why you go to France but I was on business) I was expected to go downstairs to get everything I wanted - even the WiFi key? I was travelling alone and can honestly say I did not feel safe and could hear others through the wall. The locationis good - very central and 5 mins from the Eiffel Tour and underground. The staff were as friendly as they could be given the circumstances. All in all it felt like a travel inn - stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special With Significant Downsides”
Reviews.Author: duke_clar
Reviews.Content: Located near the Trocadero in a supposedly nice neighbour. The surronding area is the one of the dirtiest place (garbage out, etc.). really dirty. The hotel is claustrophobic in general: rooms: extremely small (a lot smaller that you would guess) you wont know where to put your suitcase, let alone store it. bathroom: even smaller although finishes are ok and modern. but you will suffocate. bed: ok not too soft cleanliness: average to poor in details (bathroom walls not very clean for instance) soundproof: poor. you will hear neighbours. service: kind on average (although they tried to arrange me with their private cab driver. and of course it was more expensive than regular cabs) there's a smallish room with training equipment (would not call it a gym). all in all: dont stay

Reviews.Title: “Ecellente, the place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: starySwitzerland
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. Everything was really great, the welcome, the room, the service etc. And also the location was great, quiet in the nights but close to everything you need to see in Parsi. When we go to Paris again, this will be definitive the place we will book again !

Reviews.Title: “Great but....”
Reviews.Author: fubarinkent
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Valentines with my girlfriend (yuk I know!) for 2 nights following the excellent reviews previously. We took 1st class Eurostar from Ashford and then the tube to the hotel which was very easy to work out. The hotel was much smaller than I imagined but very nice. We were welcomed by warm staff whom were very helpful with the room, maps etc. Our room was a deluxe room and had a small balcony. It was quite cosy to be honest (i dont think any of the rooms in this hotel would have been of any great size) but very clean. The hotel overal was great for a short stay but fairly expensive and the euro exchange didnt help. I think a Gin and Tonic cost around £8. We did not eat in the hotel and options are better outside. Having said that the hotel is superbly situated and there are ample bars and restaurants around. The Tour Eiffel is 5 minutes walk and The Arc de Triumph is only 15 minutes. In addition the hotel sits in a very posh boutique area with lovely shops...at a lovely price! Overal a fantastic weekend at a big price, but highly recommended and I would certainly look no further than this hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: daniel_chung11
Reviews.Content: I book this hotel through www.tramazing.com able to find the best and cheapest rate compare to others. Hotel is in good location, clean rooms, overall is good

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cnixon1984
Reviews.Content: Very clean modern rooms, quiet at night, great location, pleasent and helpful staff who speak perfect English. We will definately go back again. We stayed two nights in this hotel due to it's location near Eiffel Tower and the Metro System. The staff was always on hand to advise us on how to get to places around Paris in perfect english. Our room was a bit small but very clean and were very comfortable. We will be returning to this hotel again because we was treated so well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Pinky80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Plaza Tour Eiffel for two nights at the beginning of March and fell in love with the place. We booked our room through the hotel website directly and prior to arrival were emailed special offers available at the time we were staying which the staff very courteously updated our booking to. We ended up staying in a deluxe room with a view of the Eiffel Tour and breakfast in bed for half the price. Upon arrival at the hotel we were warmly welcomed by staff who had very enthusiastic suggestions for dinner (and a great help the next morning with directions and sight seeing suggestions!). This hotel is a gem, 5 mintres walking distance to Plaza du Trocadero and easy access to all of Paris. Would stay here in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing romantic vacation - this hotel made all the difference”
Reviews.Author: BVThomps
Reviews.Content: My travel agent suggested this property as I specified I wanted to be close to the Eiffel Tower, and this hotel in an exclusive residential area really fit the bill! The rooms were clean, the bathroom immaculate and the breakfast is well worth it. We arrived on May 11, 2008 and stayed 5 nights in a Deluxe Room. The area was very quiet in the evenings, which made it perfect for our early morning tours. We were within a 10-15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, and a 20 minute walk to the Arch de Triumph and Champs Elysees, so our location was ideal for us. Also, the Metro Station, Trocadero, specifically lines 6 and 9, were perfect when we wanted to go into other sections of Paris and see the touristy sights, then come back to our cozy room and relax at night. There is a perfect cafe just a few steps away from the metro - Cafe du Trocadero. You can have an excellent meal in the evenings, and from their outdoor tables you have a clear view of the Eiffel Tower lit up in the evenings and you can stay as long as you like - the waiters don't rush you out. We ate there twice and both times enjoyed watching the Eiffel Tower sparkle like a Christmas tree in the late hours. The front desk staff at the hotel are extremely pleasant and helpful. The fitness room is available throughout the day and is well equipped in my opinion as well as well maintained. Also, there is water available there and we helped ourselves to refilling our water bottles just before leaving on our scheduled day trips or sightseeing. For breakfast, there is a hot buffet available and it is refreshed regularly up until about 20 minutes before closing. There is also an excellent selection of juices, pastries and cereals as well as yogurt and fresh fruit, so every appetite is taken care of. The breakfast staff will provide coffee, tea or hot cocoa and the breakfast room is very clean and the table linens and assorted pictures of the Eiffel Tower bring elegance to the overall room design. The deluxe room is a good size and typical of European hotels. There are no drawers, but they do offer several shelves and when we requested more hangers for our clothes the front desk staff responded politely and promptly. Our hairdryer was not working in the room, and a replacement hair dryer was brought to us within minutes! I simply cannot complain about this hotel. They even offer room service late into the evening. The prices are consistent with local restaurants in the area, so if you have sticker shock over the Euro, I suggest that you budget accordingly and accept the fact that it will take nearly two US dollars for every Euro you spend. As far as this hotel is concerned, I would definitely recommend it to other guests. In fact, when we stayed it was quite crowded with guests, both American and European. It seems to be a well kept secret for great Parisian hotels, and I can see why. My husband and I loved Paris, and plan to stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: warproder
Reviews.Content: > Hotel staff were eager to please > Rooms have been recently refurbished in a contemporary style and are very clean. Like most Paris rooms they are not large > Hotel and street are quite > Beds and linens are very comfortable All and all this hotel is a great place to stay during a weekend trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant little hotel”
Reviews.Author: dskeeles
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night during a business trip. Plaza Tour Eiffel is around 5 minutes' walk from Trocadero Metro station, down a quiet street - not a picturesque street, but not a bad one, and when you leave the hotel and walk down that street to see a view of the Eiffel Tower across the Seine, through the Trocadero - it's not bad. The hotel itself is excellent - newly refurbished, with modern, understated yet sophisticated decor and excellent detail. eg. as you walk out of the lift, motion sensors outside switch on subtle lighting for the floor, including spots that illuminate the room numbers on each door. A small detail, but it's like this throughout. The room was not huge, but the most was made of the space; a cleverly located narrow floor-to-ceiling mirror in the corner made it feel larger. Everything was clean, and the flat-screen TV was great, with a range of French and international channels. The service was friendly. It's a small hotel, with 4-5 small rooms per floor, and one member of staff on duty during the day. I didn't try the breakfast. WiFi is free, with a free login slip from reception; the internet connection was pretty slow (probably a domestic broadband link), and I had to quit my firewall when connecting, as it blocked the login screen. The room is a bit small for the desk, seat, and bed to fit together - I was slightly cramped at the desk. Also, Trocadero is a bit of a journey from most things, if you're there on business, so this wouldn't be my first choice for a business trip, although it's nice to get away from the bustle for a bit.

Reviews.Title: “what a team”
Reviews.Author: tanner.smith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days with our 8 year old daughter. I am the fussiest hotel stayer in the world and this hotel exceeded all my expectations for the centre of Paris. The hotel in all areas was very very clean. The room was excellent with a small but perfect bathroom. The view from the window was of a small quaint paris street. The breakfast was super. For me what set this hotel apart from the usual very expensive 5 star all singing all dancing hotels was the staff. They could not have been friendlier or more helpful. NOTHING was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Yojadi
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for no-nonsense travelers. Everything that is important has a comfortable feel : the beds and the bathrooms. The room itself is small, however that is par for the course in Paris; the rooms are also spotless. The staff are very welcoming and hospitable. The hotel is situated in a quiet neighborhood within a stone's throw of the hoopla. As well, the Trocadero metro station is a 2 minute walk. I could see th top of the Eiffel tower from my window, what a sight to wake up to. All in all, I was very satisfied and honestly don't believe that I could have done any better for the same euros; definitely will stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Plaza Tour Eiffel
HotelInfo.Address: 32 Rue de Greuze, 75116 Paris, France (Formerly Libertel Trocadéro Sablons)
